<li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Environment &amp; Infrastructure (E&amp;I) Group is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Environmental Engineering Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Austin, TX <\u002Fb>office. The following locations will also be considered: <b>Dallas, TX; Houston, TX; San Antonio, TX; Baton Rouge, LA.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Envinronmental Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n related field, and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summer 2023 Environmental Intern<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Earth &amp; Environment Team is seeking a<b> Summer 2023 Environmental Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Mount Laurel, NJ<\u002Fb> office. We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated student who is currently enrolled in an undergraduate program to assist with various office activities, with potentially some fieldwork. This internship is designed to provide current students a hands-on opportunity to apply their academic experience and develop their technical skills in a professional consulting environment.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Working under the supervision of, and support from, project managers and project technical staff who have various project-related needs including, but not limited to:<br> \n        <ul>\n         <li>Review of geological, hydrogeological, and chemical information.<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Entry, management, organization, visualization, and quality control of project data.<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Assist with preparation of project deliverables such as proposals, reports, figures, graphs, and tables.<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Support planning for field events.<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Assist field staff at project sites in support of site characterization, remediation, due diligence, compliance, monitoring, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li>Supporting administrative and general office tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Safely performing work, in the office and potentially in the field. Fieldwork may occur in all seasonal weather conditions, using equipment (with an ability to lift and move approximately 50 pounds without assistance), and operating vehicles on behalf of the company.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Environmental Science, Geology\u002FHydrogeology, Environmental Engineering, or related, Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Environmental Science\u002FEngineering, Geology\u002FHydrogeology, or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The ability to work full-time (40 hours per week; approximately 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.; Monday to Friday) this summer for approximately 3 months; field work days may be longer.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Good academic standing (transcript required).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to pass a HAZWOPER physical and be medically able to wear a tight-fitting respirator.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-LL1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 10%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Intern<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>MARLTON - LAKE CENTER EX PKWY<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-NJ-Mount Laurel<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our<b> <\u002Fb>Buildings Team<b> <\u002Fb>is seeking a<b> Property and Buildings Electrical Engineering Intern <\u002Fb>to work out of our <b>Tampa, FL <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in design using various types of CADD and Revit design software.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Electrical Engineering or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Electrical Engineering or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must have completed basic foundational courses: Intro to Engineering, Engineering Drafting Course.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Interest in engineering of complex building and their systems.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Local candidates preferred. Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship experience, leadership experience, or relevant coursework.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with AutoCAD or Revit.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-GA1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Transportation Team is seeking a<b> Senior Summer 2023 Architectural Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>New York, NY <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience using AutoCAD, Revit, To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Advisory Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023<\u002Fb> <b>Environmental Science and Planning Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Seattle, WA and\u002For Federal Way, WA<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>General planning support, including data collection, research, and documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in writing of technical reports and public-facing materials.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Contribute to the development of wetland delineation and assessment reports, biological assessments, mitigation\u002Frestoration site design and critical area assessment and permitting.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support field work\u002Fresearch, alternatives screening analyses, environmental assessments, and community outreach for public clients.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Environmental Science or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge or experience with environmental planning, permitting, or scientific assessments.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship experience, leadership experience, or relevant coursework.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with GPS data collection and GIS analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Practical scientific expertise and knowledge of ecology, biology, and permitting for in-water projects (port\u002Fwaterfront\u002Fmarine terminals) and\u002For transportation projects (federal, state, and local infrastructure).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge or experience in the following: Endangered Species Act, Marine Mammal Protection Act, Clean Water Act, National and Washington State Environmental Policy act compliance.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Compensation:<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $17.00-$27.00\u002Fhr<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Marketing Team is seeking a <b>Marketing Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Boston, MA<\u002Fb> or <b>Glastonbury, CT<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This is an opportunity to be a part delivering critical infrastructure that supports the safe and sustainable growth of the communities in which we live. While based in a specific office, the Marketing Intern will serve as a regional resource working throughout a multi-state region. The position will integrate with a high performing, supportive team of marketing coordinators, graphic designers, and strategy development staff responsible for securing some of the largest infrastructure projects in the Northeast U.S. The Marketing Intern will work with a variety of staff, from planners and engineers to designers and construction managers, supporting the marketing team with proposals, graphics, qualification packages, award submittals, resumes, project descriptions, and data management.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Property and Buildings Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Mechanical Engineering<\u002Fb> <b>Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Raleigh, NC <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> You will work with a team of experienced engineers with great mentorship skills and exciting projects in the field of building construction, including HVAC, Plumbing, Lighting, Fire Protection, and Power Distribution Systems.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of design in your discipline of engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Architectural Engineering, or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in the design of engineering systems of construction and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-GA1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Surveyor Assistant <\u002Fb>for our <b>Mooresville, NC<\u002Fb> office to support our Southeast Region Geospatial \u002F Surveying Team. The successful candidate will be part of a team conducting conventional, aerial, mobile and terrestrial surveying projects by accompanying and assisting other WSP field surveying staff members. Learn more about WSP's Geospatial Team by viewing this video. https:\u002F\u002Fvimeo.com\u002F390798645\u002Ff3e8decde8<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring the right people to be part of our future-focused business objectives. Our devotion to teamwork has allowed us to build communities and expand our skylines. Here at WSP, anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Under direct supervision, assist with collecting, compiling, and analyzing data from property\u002Futility records, deeds, land\u002Fproperty titles, structural plans, and other matrices for land surveying activities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Using survey instruments to perform field surveys for civil transportation projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>GPS surveying.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Working closely and collaboration with a dynamic team of experienced professionals..<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Observe and comply with all company and related safety rules.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Under direct supervision, use survey instruments to perform various types of property surveys on projects of basic complexity and\u002For scope, which could include boundary, existing condition, topographic, as-built, subdivision, and profile maps.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provides entry-level land surveying assistance that accounts for accurate survey data, and determines conformance with applicable rules, standards, codes, boundaries, and construction specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Generate complete, accurate, and concise documentation and specifications related to site inspection and survey findings using photographs, sketches, calculations, software, spreadsheets, technical drawings, 2D\u002F3D illustrations, and reports.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comply with safety guidelines and site-specific procedures which include but are not limited to, location data, statistical documentation, studies and surveys, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High School Diploma or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0-2 years of land survey experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to lift up to 50 pounds.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Physically mobile in and around construction sites and field assignments.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to carry survey equipment and supplies in remote, rural or urban surroundings.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to travel as projects dictate.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening, including a valid Driver's license<\u002Fli> \n       <li>This role is subject to a client mandated drug\u002Falcohol testing policy. As such, employee may be subject to random drug\u002Falcohol tests. A copy of the client mandated drug\u002Falcohol testing policy will be provided during employee onboarding and is available upon applicant request.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Associate’s Degree in closely related discipline is preferred. #LI-PJ1<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Natural Resources Team<b> <\u002Fb>is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Environmental Scientist Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Troy, NY <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>General planning support, including data collection, research, and documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in writing of technical reports and public-facing materials.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Contribute to the development of wetland delineation and assessment reports, biological assessments, mitigation\u002Frestoration site design and critical area assessment and permitting.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support field work\u002Fresearch, alternatives screening analyses, environmental assessments, and community outreach for public clients.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Environmental Science, or related, Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of, interest in, or experience with environmental planning, permitting, or scientific assessments.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Environmental Science, or related field, and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to pass a HAZWOPER physical and be medically able to wear a tight-fitting respirator.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship experience, leadership experience, or relevant coursework.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with GPS data collection and GIS analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Practical scientific expertise and knowledge of ecology, biology, and permitting for terrestrial (solar\u002Fwind\u002Ftransmission) and\u002For in-water projects (offshore wind\u002Fport\u002Fwaterfront\u002Fmarine terminals).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge or experience in the following: NYS 94-c Large Scale Renewables, NYS Article VII, NYS State Environmental Quality Review Act, Endangered Species Act, Marine Mammal Protection Act, and Clean Water Act.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Expected Salary: $16.00 - $25.00 per hour<\u002Fp> Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <div>\n        Our \n       <b>PM\u002FCM Team We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a<b> Billing Analyst <\u002Fb>for our <b>San Diego<\u002Fb> office. Be involved in projects with our<b> Enviroment &amp; Infrastructure<\u002Fb> <b>Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA has a career opportunity for a Billing Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will perform a financial function including interacting with Project Managers to ensure accurate and timely billing and revenue recognition. We offer a varied and interesting diversity of clients and projects. We would love you to join our team of friendly, hard-working, dedicated, and collaborative professionals. Our ideal candidate has 0-1 years of related work experience and has great communication and attention to detail skills. If you are seeking challenging work and are committed to quality, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity. Experience working with an Engineering\u002FConsulting firm is preferred but not required.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Reporting to our San Diego, CA office. This individual has the <b>option to work remotely from any US location<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Process billing of Time and Materials, Firm Fixed Price and Cost-plus Fixed fee projects in accordance with contract terms and conditions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to read and interpret billing terms and conditions in contracts to set up new projects accurately.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain project budgets and fees, updating per contract Modifications received.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Recognize Revenue by completing any budget changes and variance adjustments as needed.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Review WIP and A\u002FR bi-weekly for accuracy issues and WIP for aging issues for organizations you are responsible to bill.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Seek assistance from Unit &amp; Project Managers where necessary, and immediately report to direct Supervisor any problem projects or issues.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ensure all data entry documents received are verified and entered in the accounting system weekly based on current data entry procedures and timelines.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Providing information and assistance in the preparation of month end financial analysis and comments.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Process Reinstatements, revised invoices, retention invoices.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Notify Project Accounting Supervisor of any issues that cannot be performed within the Service Level Agreement schedule.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Actively participate as member of West US Project Accounting Team.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>0-1 years related work experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience working with an Engineering \u002F Consulting firm preferred<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Accounting certificate \u002F diploma an asset<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Self-starter with friendly customer service skills<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Compensation and Benefits:<br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $47,200-$85,000<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law<\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-LB1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>SAN DIEGO - SKY PARK CT<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-CA-San Diego, US-Remote<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summer 2023 Land Survey Technician Intern<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Geospatial Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Land Survey Technician Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our<b> Lawrenceville, NJ<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Work in office and\u002For field environment utilizing Cadd and Geospatial Sofware which may include AutoCad Civil 3D, MicroStation InRoads and Leica Geosystems Infininty.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Land Surveying Geospatial Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of engineeringl design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> accredited Surveying, Geometrics, or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Surveying, or related field, and have a strong desire to advance skills related to <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Structures Representative<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Full Time Structures Representative<\u002Fb> for our <b>Antioch, California<\u002Fb> office. Be involved in projects with our PMCM Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges. The position can be located within the San Francisco Bay Area, greater Sacramento area, or the Central Valley.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The Structures Representative provides technical leadership for complex construction management projects or programs, serving as a Structures Representative supervising construction engineering and inspection activities. This person must be capable of applying diversified knowledge of construction engineering principles and practices and independently making decisions on significant construction engineering problems. Elements to be inspected or monitored may include maintenance of traffic, pile driving, cofferdams, cast-in-place concrete, waterproofing, structural steel, bearings, expansion joints, precast concrete elements, maintenance or traffic and other similar activities.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This is NOT a Structural Design Engineer role. A Structures Representative is a local agency employee (or a consultant hired by a local agency) who performs quality assurance over the contractor’s work that involves structures and who performs the contract’s necessary structure-related administrative tasks.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP has offices in Antioch, Walnut Creek, San Francisco, Oakland, San Jose, Sacramento, Roseville, and Stockton. Projects may span multiple disciplines, such as roadway\u002Fhighway and transit\u002Frail construction.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Reviewing and inspecting plans and calculations for: falsework; shoring; staging; bridge removal; and other technical submissions, on City, County, and State projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Responding to and effectively resolving field construction issues<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Conducting meetings between contractor, owner, utilities and other project parties<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Inspecting, documenting, and coordinating field test of construction materials<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Analyzing construction costs of changed conditions, drafting change orders, and recommending claims dispositions<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Preparing constructability reviews and reports<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assumes responsibility for field engineering, contract administration, inspection, testing, surveying, and quality control on one large or several small construction projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Supervises field inspection and field office personnel<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Represents projects at meetings and conferences<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-TD1<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>BSCE or related Degree<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Current California PE license<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Minimum of 12 years of experience, 5 of which are as a Structures Representative<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Working knowledge of applicable codes, standards, and material<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Valid CA driver's license<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Solid written and verbal skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Relocation assistance is not available for this position.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This position is contingent upon WSP being selected for a contract or program we are currently pursuing.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This position is subject to and contingent upon client approval of candidates put forth for consideration by WSP.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> <b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n      <p>WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Expected Salary: $125,200 - $255,400<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>ANTIOCH - LONE TREE WAY<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-CA-Oakland, US-CA-San Francisco, US-CA-San Jose<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Earth &amp; Environment Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Geology\u002FHydrogeology Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our<b> Morristown, NJ<\u002Fb> or <b>Newark, NJ <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your of Geology\u002FHydrogeology.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Geology\u002FHydrogeology, or related field, and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Commissioning Team is seeking a <b>Senior Commissioning Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Arlington, VA<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Commissioning.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related Master's or PhD program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Commissioning or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience using MS Office.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-GA1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Intern<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Part<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>ARLINGTON - N 17TH<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-VA-Arlington<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Early Career Mechanical Designer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Takes part in providing local technical assistance for the design, development, building, testing, and inspecting of mechanical systems on infrastructure, building, and construction projects in the public and private sector. Tasks may include basic assistance with the research, design, concept development, installation, operation, maintenance, and optimal integration of automatic temperature control, air distribution, hydronic, and plumbing systems, equipment and processes. Generates accurate and concise documentation regarding assigned aspects of the project. Ensures that responsibilities are delivered and adhered to with a level of quality that meets or exceeds acceptable industry standards for design, safety, and functionality.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Under general supervision, assist with collecting, compiling, and analyzing data from the physical work site, surveys, blueprints, schematics, data, technical drawings, computer-generated reports, and other matrices for project development, design, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with performing basic professional mechanical engineering work relating to conducting research and inspections of proposed and existing site conditions, equipment, resources, building, infrastructure, usage, and mechanical systems to determine conformance with applicable rules, standards, and construction or operating permits.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform routine engineering functions and provide entry-level technical assistance on various design requirements, load calculations, and operating strategies to account for the proper installation and functioning of equipment and systems according to specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with verifying the characteristics of a site and providing basic technical assistance on various engineering, design, and construction issues.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Generate complete, accurate, and concise documentation and specifications using electronic systems, drawings, and field\u002Fwork site notebook\u002Flogs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comply with safety guidelines and site-specific procedures which include but are not limited to, location data, statistical documentation, engineering studies and surveys, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, or closely related discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0 to 1 years of relevant post education experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent research skills with analytical mindset.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with process and concepts for design\u002Fbuild.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with relevant mechanical system and construction laws, codes, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently under general supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with discipline-specific design software (i.e., AutoCAD, CAM).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Engineer in Training Certification.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship related to the degree of study and the specific engineering discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>A member of and\u002For actively participate in local professional practice organizations.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Compensation and Benefits:<br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $53,200 - $93,000<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-GD1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 10%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> New Graduate<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>SEATTLE - FOURTH AVE<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-WA-Seattle<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual We are involved in exciting local projects including complete streets, bicycle and pedestrian projects, streetcar, municipal streets, bridge replacements, and major highway projects. WSP offers a flexible work schedule and agile work environment that allows employees to work from home and\u002For from our modern office space in the Kansas City River Market just steps away from the Streetcar and the City Market.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Prepare roadway, aviation , traffic, drainage, utilities, survey and construction drawings to support transit, highway, local agency, and other transportation clients.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare structural details for bridges and other civil works structures. Bridge detailing tasks include modifying client standards and creating new custom details for a specific application.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform various design and quantity calculations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop concept level design for analysis<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Redesign, modify, or edit existing design<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Oversee varied and complex computer-aided drafting and design work<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop standards and symbols to meet specialized needs of a particular project<\u002Fli> \n       <li>May be responsible for design tasks of large projects under engineer in charge<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop and mentor team members<br> <\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>The selected candidate must be able to work in the United States immediately<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with ProjectWise, Microstation, InRoads SS4, Power Civil SS4, Open Roads, Open Roads Designer and or AutoCAD Civil3D<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Formal CADD training preferred and a minimum of five (5) years CADD experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Very good verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills and ability to work within a team environment<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <p><b> Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Previous experience working on KDOT, MoDOT and Kansas City Metro Area municipal projects and standards<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Experience in modelling in Open Roads, Open Roads Designer and or AutoCAD Civil 3D<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Experience in Roadway and Highway conceptual
