WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Tempe\u002FPhoenix Property and Buildings Team is seeking a full-time <b>Summer 2023 Electrical Engineering Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Tempe, AZ<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Tempe Buildings Group works on a range of large and small projects and focuses heavily on Healthcare projects. Current projects include:<\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li> Northern Arizona Greenfield Hospital replacement in Flagstaff, AZ<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Mayo Clinic West Tower hospital expansion in of Electrical Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Electrical Engineering or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Electrical Engineering or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 internship program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Climate Finance Advisors (CFA) team is seeking a <b>Senior Spring 2023 Climate Finance Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Arlington, VA <\u002Fb>and\u002For <b>New York, NY<\u002Fb> offices. CFA, member of WSP, works with clients to accelerate sustainable, climate-aligned investment to benefit society, the economy and the environment. We specialize in helping our clients develop climate finance strategies, appraise and structure climate-aligned investments, channel public and private capital to sustainable investment, and integrate climate considerations into investment decisions, financial products and services, and policies.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Research on the topic of climate finance, sustainable development, and investment to support CFA team members and client engagements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support financial modeling and analytical support for project financing, climate risk, resilience, and associated financial structures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support the preparation of funding proposals and Request for Proposals, case studies, reports, presentations, articles, and blogs, including research and drafting.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support client projects with the broader Sustainability, Energy, Climate Change (SECC) team, which includes but is not limited to sustainability reporting and disclosure; greenhouse gas inventory management; decarbonization and net zero.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>General administrative support as required to help the team manage clients, partner relationships, and CFA operations.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Finance, Economics, International Affairs, Environmental Management, or related, Masters or PhD program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in international development, clean energy investment, climate change policy, insurance, risk management, and\u002For private sector financing, or related topics, and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in at least one of the following: blended finance for climate, climate risk and disclosure, climate investment strategies, climate investment due diligence.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Advanced proficiency in reports, spreadsheets, and presentations using Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience in quantitative analysis, financial analysis, and financial modeling preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Full Time Structures Representative<\u002Fb> for our <b>Sacramento, California<\u002Fb> office. Be involved in projects with our PMCM Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges. The position can be located within the San Francisco Bay Area, greater Sacramento area, or the Central Valley.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The Structures Representative provides technical leadership for complex construction management projects or programs, serving as a Structures Representative supervising construction engineering and inspection activities. This person must be capable of applying diversified knowledge of construction engineering principles and practices and independently making decisions on significant construction engineering problems. Elements to be inspected or monitored may include maintenance of traffic, pile driving, cofferdams, cast-in-place concrete, waterproofing, structural steel, bearings, expansion joints, precast concrete elements, maintenance or traffic and other similar activities.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This is NOT a Structural Design Engineer role. A Structures Representative is a local agency employee (or a consultant hired by a local agency) who performs quality assurance over the contractor’s work that involves structures and who performs the contract’s necessary structure-related administrative tasks.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP has offices in Antioch, Walnut Creek, San Francisco, Oakland, San Jose, Sacramento, Roseville, and Stockton. Projects may span multiple disciplines, such as roadway\u002Fhighway and transit\u002Frail construction.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Reviewing and inspecting plans and calculations for: falsework; shoring; staging; bridge removal; and other technical submissions, on City, County, and State projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Responding to and effectively resolving field construction issues<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Conducting meetings between contractor, owner, utilities and other project parties<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Inspecting, documenting, and coordinating field test of construction materials<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Analyzing construction costs of changed conditions, drafting change orders, and recommending claims dispositions<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Preparing constructability reviews and reports<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assumes responsibility for field engineering, contract administration, inspection, testing, surveying, and quality control on one large or several small construction projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Supervises field inspection and field office personnel<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Represents projects at meetings and conferences<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-TD1<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>BSCE or related Degree<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Current California PE license<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Minimum of 12 years of experience, 5 of which are as a Structures Representative<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Working knowledge of applicable codes, standards, and material<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Valid CA driver's license<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Solid written and verbal skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <p> Relocation assistance is not available for this position.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This position is contingent upon WSP being selected for a contract or program we are currently pursuing.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This position is subject to and contingent upon client approval of candidates put forth for consideration by WSP.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> <b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n      <p>WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 internship program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> Our<b> Project Management and Construction Management Team <\u002Fb>is seeking a<b> Senior Summer 2023 Construction Management Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our<b> Indianapolis, IN <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Project Management and Construction Management Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with construction management, field work, quality assurance testing, and inspections.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Engineering, Construction Management, or related Undergraduate program. OR Actively enrolled in an accredited Engineering, or related, Masters or PhD program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Engineering Construction Management or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience using BIM, SiteManager, Primavera P6 or other related construction management software<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-MS1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. WSP's Communications and Public Involvement Practice is seeking a <b>Community Engagement Coordinator<\u002Fb> in our <b>Vancouver, WA or Portland, OR <\u002Fb>office. This is a project-based role, and this person will manage a community engagement team on a transportation infrastructure project.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring the best people to be part of our future-focused business objectives. Our devotion to teamwork has allowed us to build communities and expand our skylines. Here at WSP, anything is within our reach - and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<br> <br> The best candidate will be an experienced self-starter with the motivation and practice of simultaneously working on multiple and dynamic project deliverables. This requires self-accountability, including smart time management, excellent organization skills, maximizing of resources, and being results driven and proactive with challenging environments. Creativity and collaboration are essential in bringing our clients the most innovative and effective communications ideas, solutions and resources. Experience with public information and community engagement best practices will build authentic relationships with the project's communities. The person in this role should be prepared to create and deliver options and solutions for proactive public communications in a fast-paced environment.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Develop project-based community engagement strategy, development, and execution.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Create written content for materials for community engagement and public involvement<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with project-based community engagement teams, including subconsultants and clients<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment, as well as independently utilizing best practices for public information, including the quick and accurate dissemination of information to populations and partner agencies with limited resources<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Be comfortable showing discretion and diplomacy with a wide variety of community leaders and members<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support the development, production and distribution of essential information, content and updates regarding complex projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Implement strategies to engage all communities, especially underserved and marginalized people, impacted by transportation and housing projects using a variety of tools and methods including workshops, public meetings, market research, public information and advertising campaigns, visuals, and more<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Offer objective analysis regarding data from community inputs, research surveys, focus groups, polling, workshops, and public meetings<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ensure accurate and efficient dissemination of information tailored to different audiences<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Oversee language translation of materials by internal staff or subcontractors<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide proofing and quality control processes of communications materials<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work closely with the creative team, equity team, media team, and public affairs team to ensure streamlined messaging and responsiveness<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Attend and staff community events and briefings as needed.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor's degree (in <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summer 2023 Environmental Scientist (Natural Resources) Intern<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 internship program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Northeast Earth &amp; Environment Team is seeking a <b>Senior Summer 2023 Environmental Scientist (Natural Resources) Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Morristown, NJ <\u002Fb>and\u002For<b>Lawrenceville, NJ<\u002Fb> offices.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Respond to complex issues for natural environments in a context of climate change by combining design and scientific knowledge to produce the best projects for our clients.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Collect data and gather information and documents.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with wetland delineation\u002Frestoration and ecology studies, assist with the design of ecosystem restoration projects, develop environmental resource maps.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Organize and modify geospatial data and create maps using ArcGIS.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide support for project tracking and organization to our project management staff.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide support for project plan development, research, technical calculations, cost estimating, permit applications, and technical report writing.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform field visits and site reconnaissance as dictated by project requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Natural Resources, Environmental Science, or related Masters or PhD program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Environmental Science and Natural Resources, or related field, and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Coursework in ecology, geology, biology, natural sciences or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work as a team player and take direction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Detail-oriented with an emphasis on quality work products.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comfortable presenting ideas, projects and solutions to clients and executives in a polished, professional manner.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently under minimal supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Advanced proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience with ArcGIS, Trimble GPS software, Scuba or NJ Boat Captain License.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-LL1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Bridge\u002FStructural Engineering Team is seeking a full-time <b>Summer 2023 Structural Engineering Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Denver, CO<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Structural Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Structures or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a full-time <b>Senior Graphic Designer<\u002Fb> in Any US City where we have an office. A few of many possibilities include <b>Tampa, San Francisco, Chicago, Boston and Denver . <\u002Fb>This position will work within our award-winning Strategic Growth Team - a multi-faceted and industry-best marketing, sales and communications organization.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><b> Key duties include:<\u002Fb><br> Creating highly-polished, aesthetically-pleasing, original artwork, illustrations, and visual solutions, using custom graphic design, infographics, video clips and motion graphics, audio, text, and statistical data, delivered in print and online formats.<br> Independent design of graphic design projects.<br> Supporting a marketing team with diverse design assignments, primarily in InDesign.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Create original design concepts that inform and engage technical and non-technical audiences across a variety of digital and print platforms; design interactive experiences across multiple digital platforms.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Independent design of deliverables<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Hour estimating individual tasks<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Self-directed<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Some interface with internal clients<\u002Fli> \n       <li>QA\u002FQC<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Create highly-polished, aesthetically-pleasing, original artwork, illustrations, and visual solutions, using custom graphic design, infographics, video clips and motion graphics, audio, text, and statistical data, delivered in print and online formats.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain knowledge of and proficiency with the latest technologies and trends in the graphic design environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>May require researching and employing new software technology and design\u002Fdevelopment techniques.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficiency in operation of presentation software technology and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Collaborate with project managers and teams, client agency staff, and technical experts; including accepting critiques and addressing feedback.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>5+ years with BA in graphic design, digital design, web design, visual communications, or related discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Possess creative and innovative design skills and artistic talent and be adept at applying user usability concepts to design.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven understanding of graphic design fundamentals; strong command of color theory, image composition, and typography; demonstrated design creativity and ability to translate creative ideas to visual solutions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated ability to take a project from concept to launch; detail oriented, focused on efficiency and quality; and adept at collaboration in a fast-paced team environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comfortable with daily multi-tasking, and possessing the ability to self-manage tasks on multiple short and long-term projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Be an articulate, attentive listener, comfortable with client relations, and willing to be flexible and adaptable to changing requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Attention to detail and quality<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Collaborative<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Skilled design communicator<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Adept at Teams or virtual\u002Fremote communication<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Compensation and Benefits<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $67,200 - $133,000<br> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-MQ1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summer 2023 Mechanical Engineering Intern<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our kW Mission Critical Mechanical Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Mechanical Engineering Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Atlanta, GA<\u002Fb> office. The ideal candidate is motivated, proactive, and excited to learn. Shows a strong interest in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, communicating and collaborating with internal and external design, client, and construction team members, and a desire to travel. As a <b>Mechanical Engineering Intern <\u002Fb>with us, you will design HVAC cooling systems including air distribution systems, chiller plants, and alternative energy solutions.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Keep the internet running and the world working!<br> At kW Mission Critical Engineering, a part of WSP USA, that’s exactly what we do.<br> Simply, data centers are buildings that store information technology. These mission critical facilities must remain operational 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Your role is to design the building infrastructure—power and cooling systems—to make sure that happens.<br> <br> Be a part of an engineering team where from day one, you will collaborate and add value to every project. Gain invaluable experience early in your career. Not only will you be designing building systems, you’ll interact with all internal mechanical, electrical, plumbing, fire protection, and telecommunication engineers, external design partners like architects and structural engineers, and equipment vendors for the development of drawings and specifications. Then, travel to project locations during construction and watch your designs being built for some of the largest companies in the world.<br> <br> Do you want to work on innovative, award-winning projects, travel and see your designs being built, and enjoy an occasional game of ping-pong, lunch and learn, or after-hours’ camaraderie? Are you looking for career growth? Join our great people at our great places designing great projects.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Works with the guidance from senior engineers to perform a variety of assignments requiring the application of standard engineering and design techniques<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with multi-discipline project teams to develop drawing and specification documents for issuance to architects, contractors and building owners.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Attend client meetings<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Collaborate and coordinate with internal project discipline team members, equipment vendors and manufacturers.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Design and draft air distributions systems and hydronic systems using AutoDesk’s Revit platform<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare cooling\u002Fheating load calculations and conduct psychometric evaluations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Evaluate energy efficient heating and cooling systems<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Select and schedule major equipment based on load calculations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform Computational Fluid Dynamic (CFD) evaluations for existing and new facilities, both internal and external<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform construction administration tasks with oversight from experienced staff<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Survey and evaluate existing conditions with oversight from experienced staff<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Architectural Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Architectural Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Interest in innovative design for high performing data centers and mission critical facilities<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience using AutoCAD and\u002For Revit<\u002Fli> \n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Intern<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>ATLANTA - PERIMETER CENTER<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-GA-Atlanta<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a Entry-Level Geologist for our Portland. Maine office. Be involved in projects with our Environment &amp; Infrastructure Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Oversee soil borings and groundwater monitoring well installations, collect soil, groundwater, surface water, sediment, air, and soil gas samples, collect data in complex field situations with supervision, and document field activities<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform other field exploration, inspection, testing, and analyses using equipment and instrumentation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare components of site investigation reports including work plans, data summaries, calculations, tables, figures, charts, drawings and report text<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Collect samples and data during remedies and pilot studies from soil and groundwater remediation systems<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist Project Managers and project teams, ensuring effective client communication and relations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Organize field work, assign tasks, and work with other staff specialists and technicians to complete assignments<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follow company safety policies and procedures, site safety standards, and permit requirements<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 Engineering, or related technical field<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong writing skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Effective verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must have personal transportation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Physical Demands: Ability to remain on feet for extended periods of time either stationary or walking<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Field activities may require working in unfavorable weather conditions, including heat and cold<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to lift 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to pass a HAZWOPER physical\u002F Fit for Duty <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>On-Call Master Electricians<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for <b>part-time, on-call Master Electricians<\u002Fb> to work out of any WSP office, including <b>Orlando, FL; Miami, FL; Raleigh, NC; Columbia, SC; San Juan, PR; Dallas, TX; Houston, TX; San Jose, CA; and Los Angeles, CA.<\u002Fb> Be involved in projects with our <b>Federal Programs Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> We are seeking individuals who are eager to assist during disasters on an on-call basis as a reservist employee, with the availability to deploy with little or no advance notice and for potentially long durations.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Visit this link to learn more about our Federal Programs Team https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002FKB7CcSJ45qw<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Manage and lead Electrical teams, providing services to clients preparing for, responding to, and recovering from disasters nationwide.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Lead and perform oversight of on-site duties including PII’s logistics, supply, cost\u002Fdocumentation and\u002For resource unit functions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Attend periodic training throughout the year to maintain deployment eligibility.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support Emergency Management Project Management functions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>HS diploma or GED.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>9+ years relevant experience, including 2+ years of experience in the electrical installation, mechanical, installation, repair and maintenance of emergency standby generators.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of standards, procedures, methods, and techniques, applicable to emergency power and construction projects including equipment, materials, and utility\u002F medium voltage systems.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must possess Master Journeyman Electrical License\u002FCertification. DOD AT1, First Aid\u002FCPR\u002FAED, OSHA 10 are strongly preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Requires General Industry, or Construction Industry Safety with previous emergency response experience during disaster events involving emergency power and O&amp;M services as a QA or Electrician.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of inspection, test, and measurement techniques related to emergency power projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to inspect electrical installations and identify potential hazards or problems and have a deep understanding of electrical safety including arc flash protection, and oversight to enforce proper installation techniques with an emphasis on utility separation, deinstallation, safety, grounding and bonding.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to provide training in electrical topics related to the mission.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>FEMA Emergency Management Institute Independent Study - Professional Development Series certification (IS-100\u002F102\u002F200\u002F700\u002F800\u002F815).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>This position requires the ability to travel and deploy to disaster area, with little or no advance notice and potentially for long durations, which could be up to a minimum of 30 days.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>NFPA 70e Training Certification, or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Compensation and Benefits:<br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Water Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Water Resources Intern <\u002Fb>to work out of our <b>Baltimore, MD <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Assist senior engineers in the development of a wide variety of water resource design, assessment, planning and monitoring projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform basic stormwater management, drainage, water\u002Fwastewater, erosion sediment control design analyses including performing calculations under the guidance of senior engineers.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn and utilize CADD and GIS tools to determine drainage areas and other hydrologic components in support of H&amp;H analyses.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform field investigations, assessments and surveys under the guidance of senior engineers to support our design projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare components of technical reports under the guidance of senior engineers summarizing analyis and project requirements<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Water Resources Engineering, Civil Engineering, Environmental Engineering, or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Water Resources Engineering or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship<\u002Fli> \n To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Program Management &amp; Construction Management (PMCM) Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Project Management Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>New York, NY<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Project Management for Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Planning, Engineering, or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Engineering Project Management, or related field, and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding internship<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience using BIM, Rhino or any other related 3D applications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Property and Buildings Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Electrical Engineering<\u002Fb> <b>Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Charlotte, NC <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> You will work with a team of experienced engineers with great mentorship skills and exciting projects in the field of building construction, including HVAC, Plumbing, Lighting, Fire Protection, and Power Distribution Systems.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of design in your discipline of engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Architectural Engineering, or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in the design of engineering systems of construction and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. Work is performed under moderate to light supervision. Performance of routine traffic management tasks are inherent to this position and applicants must have the ability to perform all functions applicable to a TMC System Operator I and TMC System Operator II. The TMC Shift Manager is responsible for ensuring shift co-workers are kept up-to date and implements new procedures. Responsible for ensuring that proper contacts are made and protocols are followed during major incident events.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Assists NYSDOT Project Manager<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Available all times during off-duty hours to provide assistance to Operations personnel<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible for ensuring shift co-workers are adequately trained and current in all tasks relevant to their position;<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Serves as the shift liaison to management for identifying problems and\u002For weaknesses in operational procedures;<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Independently prepares and maintains training documents and reports;<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Support TMC operations during higher-level incidents, emergencies, snow, storms, and other significant events; gather and report incident management, traffic conditions, and transportation network status to NYSDOT staff<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Responsible for shift continuity, assessments, briefings between shifts, and overall system performance;<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Administers On-The-Job (OJT) training to new and existing staff as needed;<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Attend Management meetings and collaborate with internal stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Maintain scheduling and PTO requests amongst team members.<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Policy and directives, record keeping<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Develop innovative ideas to improve processes and efficiencies of the workflow.<\u002Fli>\n       <li>Proven class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for an <b>Environmental Technician<\u002Fb> for the <b>Greensboro, NC office<\u002Fb>. Be involved in projects with our Earth &amp; Environment Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Conduct monitoring events that include following standards and procedures for sampling of groundwater, stormwater, soil, surface water, and landfill gas<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in the operation and maintenance of landfill gas control and treatment systems. – remove bullet<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform groundwater well development events<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform field calibrations, measurements, and calculations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Record and compile field data using field meters<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform assigned office duties, such as data entry, support report preparation, laboratory data reviews, and borehole logs<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Coordinate and communicate with client representatives, subcontractors, and WSP employees<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High school diploma<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Three years of relevant experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to independently complete field assignments and summarize field data for use in reporting<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient MS Office skills and data collection tablets<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to safely lift 40 pounds<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong commitment to safety, including following established Health and Safety protocols<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong initiative, problem-solving and communication skills, and attention to detail<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Good verbal and written communication skills and a professional attitude<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Willingness to travel for field assignments as dictated by project demands (including to remote locations and outside work in various climates up to 50% of time)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Two-year technical degree in the field of geology, environmental sciences, or a related discipline<\u002Fli> \n       <li>40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Hands-on field experience, including familiarity\u002Fexperience with groundwater and soil sampling techniques and field procedures<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-SV1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 90%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>GREENSBORO - OAK BRANCH DR<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-NC-Greensboro<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Property and Buildings Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 <\u002Fb><b>Mechanical Engineering Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>York, PA <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli>
