<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summer 2023 Mechanical Engineering Intern<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Sacarmento Transportation Team is seeking a full-time <b>Summer 2023 Mechanical Engineering Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Sacarmento, CA<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> As an intern, you will be involved in projects with our Northern California District Transportation Mechanical Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges. Duties may include assistance with drawings production, calculations to support various transportation infrastructure mechanical designs such as HVAC, Plumbing, Fire Protection and Fire life safety systems.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> The ideal candidate will have the opportunity to:<\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Assist with interpreting client requirements, identifying and addressing design parameters.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with the following tasks: Equipment sizing, hydraulic calculations, pipe sizing, material selection and specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop technical documention including specifications, data-sheets, technical bid analysis, etc.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Participate in our local and nationwide internship experience program that offers networking, and personal\u002Fprofessional development opportunities thoughout the summer.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an accredited Mechanical Engineering or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Mechanical Engineering or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must have completed basic foundational courses.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools, including Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams and PowerPoint.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Detail-oriented with an emphasis on quality work products.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>This role may be subject to a client-mandated drug\u002Falcohol testing policy. As such, employee may be subject to random drug\u002Falcohol tests.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience using AutoCAD or Microstation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Compensation:<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $17.00-$27.00\u002Fhr<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-SS1<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Intern<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>ROSEVILLE - ENTERPRISE WAY<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-CA-Sacramento<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Sr. CAD Designer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a<b> Senior CAD Designer <\u002Fb>for our<b> Las Vegas, NV<\u002Fb> office. The following locations will also be considered: <b>Los Angeles-CA, Orange-CA, San Diego-CA<\u002Fb>, and <b>San Bernardino-CA<\u002Fb>. Be involved in projects with our <b>Transportation Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring the right people to be part of our future-focused business objectives. Our devotion to teamwork has allowed us to build communities and expand our skylines. Here at WSP, anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Use 3D computer-aided design and drafting (CADD) software and work closely with engineers to resolve design details or discrepancies, and to prepare drawings which require a high degree of precision on projects of moderate complexity and\u002For scope.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follows standard practices to provide technical design assistance and guidance that accounts for the proper illustration, fit form, and function using geometric dimensioning, tolerance and quantity calculations, while ensuring the construction and maintainability of designs according to design standard specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Acts as consultant regarding work progress and problem resolution; may serve as the only Drafting\u002FDesign Support resource on a project or assist in overseeing Drafting\u002FDesign Support activities for projects of a moderate scope and complexity within a district.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Verify accuracy of calculations, design, change orders, interpretation of contract plans and specifications, recognizing moderate to slightly intricate construction or engineering problems and escalating or resolving any differences, errors, or technical problems for appropriate resolution.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with cross-functional teams in executing project work.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assure plans adhere to city code, state and federal regulations.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare multiple versions of designs for review by engineer.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Monitor drafting and design plans to ensure quality control and contract compliance; documenting work progress and issues arising throughout scope of project.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work collaboratively with the engineer-in-charge and other technical professionals on assigned project phases, segments, checks, and tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Apply analytical techniques and software to solve more intricate and involved engineering issues on projects, or to modify or redesign existing designs in accordance with project standards and specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Engage in occasional contact with client and contractor personnel to schedule and coordinate project drafting and design support review.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide guidance and training to entry-level drafting and design support staff.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Remain current in latest drafting and design support knowledge, techniques, and practices.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High School Diploma.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Minimum of 9 years of relevant post education experience in discipline with prior drafting and design support experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Well-defined knowledge of drafting and design support principles, practices, process, methods and techniques.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Well-defined knowledge of relevant codes, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Defined ability to make technical computations and calculations involving the application of geometry and mathematical concepts, understanding plans and specifications, and making factual comparisons to the appropriate standards or regulations.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Analytical mindset with an ability to exercise sound judgment in evaluating situations and making decisions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to a technical and non-technical audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, accuracy, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, follow instruction, work independently, and comply with company policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Highly proficient with technical writing, office automation, software, technology, math principles, spreadsheets, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Developed critical thinking and problem-solving skills required to apply technical knowledge to reach conclusions from data collation, calculations, statistical analysis and arriving at the most effective and logical solution.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualification<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in closely related discipline is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Essential professional licensure\u002Fcertification.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Compensation and Benefits:<br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $66,100 - $126,900<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-RF1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>LAS VEGAS - S 4TH ST<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-CA-Los Angeles, US-CA-Orange, US-CA-San Bernardino, US-CA-San Diego, US-NV-Las Vegas<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summer 2023 Electrical Engineering Intern<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <div>\n        Our \n       <b>Federal Programs Electrical Engineering Team <\u002Fb>is seeking an \n       <b>Electrical Engineer Intern <\u002Fb>to work out of our \n       <b>Washington, DC or Virginia Beach <\u002Fb>office.\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv> \n      <div>\n       Our \n       <b>Federal Programs Architecture and Engineering Practice<\u002Fb> is comprised of highly motivated engineers, architects and interior designers with a variety of technical backgrounds working in several key locations across the US and internationally. Major clients are U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, U.S. Navy, U.S. Coast Guard, U.S. Postal Service, and U.S. National Park Service. Be involved in projects with our \n       <b>Engineering Team<\u002Fb> supporting \n       <b>Federal Programs<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Electrical Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic design and production software like AGi-32, Visual Lighting, Revit and AutoCAD.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform design production using Revit and AutoCAD, basic electrical design and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an ABET-accreditaed or related Undergraduate program. OR Actively enrolled in an ABET-accredited in electrical engineering or architectural engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Electrical Engineering or related field and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience using Autodesk Revit, Bluebeam, and Microsoft Office software.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-MS1<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $22- $25<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 25%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Intern<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>WASHINGTON - 23RD STREET NW<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-DC-Washington<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Summer 2023 - Marketing Intern<\u002Fb> for our <b>Central Region<\u002Fb> . Be part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges. The position can be located within any of our offices in the 16-state Central Region, major markets include Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Missouri, and Texas.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This Marketing Intern will be a part of delivering critical infrastructure that supports the safe and sustainable growth of the communities in which we live. The position will integrate with a high performing, supportive team of marketing coordinators, graphic designers, and strategy development staff responsible for securing some of the largest infrastructure projects in the Central U.S.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The Marketing Intern will support the marketing team on proposals, graphics, qualification packages, award submittals, resumes, project descriptions, and data management.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Prepare materials for proposal submissions<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare materials for presentations or client meetings<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Gather information on clients, and prospective client projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in analyzing data<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with requests for information, drafting correspondence<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with updating marketing materials, including resumes and project descriptions<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Other duties as assigned<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Talent is the essence of meeting our client’s objectives, goals and challenges. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Early Career Environmental Scientist<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a Entry-Level Geologist\u002F Environmental Scientist\u002FEnvironmental Engineer for our Rocky Hill, CT office. Be involved in projects with our Environment &amp; Infrastructure Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Oversee soil borings and groundwater monitoring well installations, collect soil, groundwater, surface water, sediment, air, and soil gas samples, collect data in complex field situations with supervision, and document field activities<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform other field exploration, inspection, testing, and analyses using equipment and instrumentation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare components of site investigation reports including work plans, data summaries, calculations, tables, figures, charts, drawings and report text<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Collect samples and data during remedies and pilot studies from soil and groundwater remediation systems<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist Project Managers and project teams, ensuring effective client communication and relations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Organize field work, assign tasks, and work with other staff specialists and technicians to complete assignments<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follow company safety policies and procedures, site safety standards, and permit requirements<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>BS or BA in Geology, Environmental Science or Engineering, or related technical field<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong writing skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Effective verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must have personal transportation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Physical Demands: Ability to remain on feet for extended periods of time either stationary or walking<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Field activities may require working in unfavorable weather conditions, including heat and cold<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to lift 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to pass a HAZWOPER physical<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-SS2<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Construction Inspector<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a Full-Time Construction Inspector for our <b>Seattle, WA<\u002Fb> office. Be involved in projects with our <b>PMCM Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Collect, compile, and analyze data from the physical work site, surveys, structural plans, blueprints, schematics, data, technical drawings, flow diagrams, material sampling, computer-generated reports, and other matrices for single, multi-phase, or multi-site field inspection activities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Use survey instruments, metering devices, and test equipment to perform inspections on projects of moderate complexity and\u002For scope, including proposed and existing site conditions, equipment, construction, materials, controls, resources, layout, alignment, and elevation to determine conformance with applicable rules, standards, codes, and construction or operating permits.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follow standard practices to provide technical assistance and guidance that accounts for the proper inspection, construction, and functioning of buildings, highways, roads, bridges, materials, structures, infrastructure, equipment, and\u002For mechanical systems according to design standard specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Act as consultant regarding work progress and problem resolution; may serve as the only inspector on a construction project or assist in overseeing construction inspection activities for projects of a moderate scope and complexity within a district.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Verify load calculations, change orders, interpretation of contract plans and specifications; resolving differences in interpretation of plans and specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Monitor project phasing plans and contractors' work to ensure quality control and contract compliance; documenting work progress and issues arising throughout scope of project.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with cross-functional teams in executing project work.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Attend pre-construction meetings and answer questions from contractors and other attendees.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with calculating payments due to contractors for work completed.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Write technical reports summarizing inspection findings and conclusions; generating complete, accurate, and concise documentation using photographs, sketches, calculations, software, spreadsheets, technical drawings, flow diagrams, 2D\u002F3D illustrations, and reports.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist technical staff, project managers, and contractors with risk identification and assessment, offering input, analysis, escalation, or resolution with construction, mitigation, and improvement activities for more intricate and involved construction or engineering problems.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with work plan preparation and coordination of any field\u002Fsite work, reviewing staffing, and equipment utilization data and time\u002Fcost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide guidance and training to entry-level inspection staff.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Engage in contact with client and contractor personnel to schedule and coordinate project inspection.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-TD1<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High School Diploma.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Minimum of 9 years of relevant post education experience in discipline with prior construction inspection experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Essential professional licensure\u002Fcertification(s).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Valid state driver’s license.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Well-defined knowledge of construction inspection principles, field inspection practices, process, methods and techniques.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Well-defined knowledge of relevant construction codes, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Analytical mindset with an ability to exercise sound judgement in evaluating situations and making decisions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to a technical and non-technical audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, accuracy, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, follow instruction, and comply with company policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Highly proficient with technical writing, office automation, software, technology, math principles, spreadsheets, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent critical thinking and problem-solving skills required to apply technical knowledge to reach conclusions from inspection and testing results, data collation, load calculations, statistical analysis and arriving at the most effective, economical, and logical solution.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to direct others in the field such as subcontractors and junior-level staff to consistently complete tasks safely, efficiently, and accurately according to specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP's Motor Vehicle screening<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in closely related discipline is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n      <p>WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Expected Salary: $66,100- $126,900<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>SEATTLE - FOURTH AVE<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-WA-Seattle<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Property &amp; Buildings Mechanical Engineering Team is seeking a full-time <b>Summer 2023 Mechanical Engineering Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Irvine, CA<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Building Mechanical Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Demolition Manager<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change. As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Are you a Demolition Manager (CM) with 10-15 years of direct field oversight experience? Are you looking for an opportunity to oversee technically challenging decommissioning and demolition (D&amp;D) and environmental remediation projects? Are you looking for an opportunity to work with an established global engineering\u002Fconsulting firm that values its employee’s enthusiasm and technical contributions? If so, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity.<br> <br> WSP is currently seeking a Demolition Manager to join our Novi, Michigan team. The role will provide field oversight and support the planning and execution of D&amp;D, remedial construction, and other civil construction projects. D&amp;D projects range from small ancillary structures to large power or chemical plant facilities. Environmental remediation projects typically include construction of remediation systems, excavation, caps\u002Fcovers, and sediment dredging and stabilization. The position is approximately 95 percent field work\u002Ftravel and 5 percent office work for a wide range of industrial, commercial, federal, state, and municipal clients.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Oversight of contractors and management of WSP onsite project personnel for compliance with project designs, specifications, and contract requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Review contractor submittals including qualifications, equipment specifications, data, and Work Plans for compliance with specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Monitor proper documentation of construction activities by contractors.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly construction reports.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in preparation of plans and specifications used to procure contractors to execute the work, bidding documents, and requests for proposals.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare or assist in conceptual construction cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Understand regulated materials and waste management requirements\u002Fprocedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Track contractor payment applications, requests for information, change order requests and general construction phase submittals.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop and maintain project schedules (master and look-ahead).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Project closeout activities including final inspections, completion of punch lists, and record drawings.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Interface with WSP clients, government officials and other stakeholders.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain permits and training certificates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain and develop vendor and other professional contacts.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Participate in training events, project meetings, and construction\u002Fengineering team meetings.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work and travel safely, follow company and site safety standards.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Travel to project sites throughout the US.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Approximately 10-15 years of field construction management experience, preferably on D&amp;D and\u002For remediation construction projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Understanding of means and methods associated with D&amp;D, remediation technologies, civil work, CSI specifications, and construction drawings.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain and advocate a safe working environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>General understanding of electrical, mechanical, plumbing, and general building systems.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong fundamental math skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent communication, both verbal and written, and organizational abilities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficiency in use of MS Word, Excel, Project.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work both independently and as part of a team and flexibility to work outside of normal business hours.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must pass drug test, entrance physical, and background check and must have a satisfactory driving record in accordance with the Company's driving (MVR) policy.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>B.S. degree in Engineering or Construction Management, or related.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>OSHA HAZWOPER 40-hour training in accordance with 29CFR1910.120<\u002Fli> \n       <li>OSHA HAZWOPER Site Supervisor<\u002Fli> \n       <li>OSHA 30-hour Construction Safety<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-SS2<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 90%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>NOVI - MAGELLAN DR<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-MI-Novi<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual Orientation\u002FGender Identity\u002FNational Origin\u002FDisability or Protected Veteran Status.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Early Career Environmental Scientist<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for an <b>Early Career Environmental Consultant<\u002Fb> for our <b>Morristown, NJ<\u002Fb> office. The following locations will also be considered: Jersey City, NJ; Lawrenceville, NJ; Newark, NJ and Upper Saddle River, NJ. Be involved in projects with our <b>Earth &amp; Environment Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This position requires the assistance of various tasks to support permitting of a number of projects ranging in offshore wind, utility, energy, transportation, and infrastructure projects. The applicant will acquire in-depth knowledge of permit applications, wetland and stream impacts, rare, threatened, and endangered species consultation, land use, water quality, and stormwater management. Familiarity with these issues and their application to land development projects is strongly preferred. The Environmental Consultant will also be supporting business development efforts for our expanding environmental services practice. The position offers great potential for professional growth in stimulating work.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Assist in developing permit applications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Supporting clients directly and indirectly on regulatory objectives including consultation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Engage in Project Management training that includes successfully managing project tasks. Project management training will also include project scope development, cost estimation, staff resource identification, implementation oversight, budget tracking, and completion of administrative requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with natural resource fieldwork, including bird and bat, cultural, wetland delineation, and other studies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Wetland delineations and\u002For biological fieldwork experience is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in writing survey reports and prepare permit applications for federal and\u002For state environmental permits, including U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Section 404 and Section 10, PA, NJ, MD, and\u002For DE state wetland and stream permits, and U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service coordination.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Conduct environmental permitting for energy\u002Ftransportation and industry clients.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Attention and commitment to timely completion of high-quality work.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Attend and facilitate stakeholder meetings and public hearings.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Coordinate with local, state, and federal agencies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Use topographic maps, aerial photographs, GPS units, and other maps and tools to determine the exact locations of project areas, site impact, habitat types, and associated physical and wildlife sensitivities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with preparing environmental survey reports, data entry, and impact assessment, and assist with permitting activities for assigned projects (e.g. Endangered Species Act, Clean Water Act permitting, CEQA, NEPA, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform professional environmental science work and assist with conducting investigations, inspections, and environmental studies and surveys to gain further information on a particular environmental problem or issue, verify site characteristics, and\u002For to plan for future environmental needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare data and visualizations such as tables, charts, accurate reports, and illustrations for the interpretation or presentation of data, findings, or analyses.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in writing technical reports summarizing research with findings and conclusions, generating complete, accurate, and concise documentation using electronic systems, field\u002Fwork site notes, and software.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comply with safety guidelines and site-specific procedures which include but are not limited to, the maintenance of sample collection, laboratory documentation, written procedures, monitoring systems, and logbooks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in the analysis, evaluation, and interpretation of environmental data obtained during field investigations, offering input with developing action plans for low to mid-level threat mitigation and permitting activities projects to minimize impacts to the health of the environment and the population.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with the development and scoping of small- to medium-sized projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with cross-functional teams in executing project work.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources, and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>BS\u002FBA in environmental studies, planning, natural resources, biology, wildlife, engineering or related field.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0-1 years of relevant experience with interest in conducting research, assisting with project management, analyzing data, and preparing written documents for energy\u002Ftransportation-related projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience\u002Finterest with developing state and federal environmental permit applications and supporting documentation in NJ and mid-Atlantic states.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent written and oral interpersonal communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work with and potentially manage interdisciplinary teams.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Willingness to travel 20%+ of the time within US.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to problem solve and think creatively.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Analytical skills, and prior experience with research techniques, local\u002Fregional ecology and habitats, and applicable species required.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of relevant environmental laws, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to a scientific and non-scientific audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Effective self-leadership with attention to detail, results orientation, and managing multiple priorities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, follow instructions, work independently, and comply with company policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Moderate proficiency with business writing, office automation, and communication software, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are required to reach conclusions from testing results, and data collation, and identify the most effective manner to accomplish the objectives of assigned projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety, and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>MS\u002FMA in a related field preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior experience as an intern in the environmental field.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Training in wetland delineation<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Environmental Field Technician<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for an <b>Environmental Field Technician<\u002Fb> for our <b>Jacksonville, FL <\u002Fb>office. Be involved in projects with our <b>Earth &amp; Environment Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>The successful candidate will conduct routine operation and maintenance of groundwater, soil vapor, and landfill gas remeditation systems.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Additional duties and responsibilities will include conducting monitoring events that follow standards and procedures for sampling groundwater, soil gas, soil, sediment, surface water, and landfill gas.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with other field activities as needed including, but not limited to, geophysical surveys, stormwater and wetland surveying, etc.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform all duties within established deadlines while maintaining a high level of accuracy.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High School Diploma required.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Working knowledge of plumbing, electrical, and mechanical devices.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0-2 years of relevant work experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Good interpersonal, documentation, and computer skills (Outlook, Word, and Excel).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Fundamental understanding of sample collection and chain of custody protocol.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with system controls and telemetry helpful.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to record information in a legible and accurate manner. (Field Notes)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Professional oral and written communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Travel is required, up to 60%, depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to work up to 12-hours outdoors.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds and walk up\u002Fdown slopes.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to pass a HAZWOPER physical and be medically able to wear a tight-fitting respirator.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>This role is subject to a client-mandated drug\u002Falcohol testing policy. As such, employee may be subject to random drug\u002Falcohol tests. A copy of this policy will be provided during employee onboarding and is available upon applicant request.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>40-Hour OSHA Health &amp; Safety Training (HAZWOPER) (29 CFR 1910.120) preferred. #LI-SV1<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 60%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>JACKSONVILLE - BAYMEADOWS RD<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-FL-Jacksonville<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs.
