<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Administrative Technician<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Be involved in projects with our New York Transportation Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for an <b>Administrative Technician<\u002Fb> to join our <b>New York City, NY<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This position is the Lead metals coordinator for NYCT Worldwide Inspection Program. This program requires that all material procured by New York City Transit (NYCT) be tested and inspected in order to meet the standards specified by each NYCT User Group.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Coordinate factory and sample inspections with vendors, manufacturers and testing laboratories.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Create the laboratory test protocols utilizing approved vendor drawings, NYCT specifications, NYCT Purchase Orders and Industry Standards (ASTM, AREMA, ANSI, SAE, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop inspection protocols by referencing specifications, drawings and industry standards to streamline the inspection processes, increase productivity, optimize quality, and expedite processes.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain a library of drawings, specifications, industry standards and inspection protocols.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform quality assurance reviews by reviewing inspection reports as compared to specifications, standard drawings, and purchase order requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Participate in project meetings.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide technical assistance and perform tasks as directed.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Implement\u002Frecommend process improvements for the inspection and testing program and suggested revisions \u002F improvements to NYCT specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Determine well-defined methods for collecting, compiling, and analyzing data from the physical work site, surveys, blueprints, GIS data, subsurface utility information, maps, hydrologic analysis, geotechnical data, and other matrices for project development, design, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform professional transit and rail engineering work and conduct research and inspections of proposed and existing site conditions, resources, building, infrastructure, and transportation corridors to determine conformance with applicable rules, standards, and construction or operating permits.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain quality control standards and procedures for accurate and precise measurements, statistical analysis, and reporting.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide guidance and training to entry-level engineers.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in the analysis, evaluation, and interpretation of data obtained during field investigations, offering input with developing action plans for moderate- to high-level risk mitigation activities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare and implement site Health and Safety Plans (HASPs).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comply with regulatory requirements pertaining to the data integrity, documentation, procedures, training, monitoring systems, and record compliance and retention.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Interact with regulatory agencies, subcontractors, and clients in a confident and professional manner.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Remain current in latest transit and rail engineering techniques and practices.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work collaboratively with other engineers, planners, scientific professionals, and infrastructure authorities on Federal, State, regional, and locally funded improvement and development projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, or closely related discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>5 to 7 years of relevant inspection, administrative, and supervisory experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Engineer in Training Certification.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Effective interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Highly capable self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently and provide guidance and leadership to junior team or project members, with strict adherence to QA\u002FQC.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Developed critical thinking and problem-solving skills required to apply technical knowledge to reach conclusions from testing results, data collation, statistical analysis and arriving at the most effective, economical, and logical solution.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to assertively direct others in the field such as subcontractors and others to consistently complete tasks safely and efficiently.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Master’s Degree in Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Essential Professional Licensure\u002FCertification.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience managing small to mid-size projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>40-Hour OSHA Health &amp; Safety Training (HAZWOPER) (29 CFR 1910.120) preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic First Aid and Adult CPR training desired.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $74,900 - $148,500<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-KCL<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 10%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>NEW YORK - BROADWAY<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-NY-Lancaster, US-NY-Latham, US-NY-Long Island City, US-NY-New York, US-NY-Pittsford, US-NY-Rochester, US-NY-Troy, US-NY-Utica<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Environmental Field Technician<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for an <b>Environmental Field Technician<\u002Fb> for the <b>Redmond, WA <\u002Fb>office. Be involved in projects with our <b>Site Assessment and Restoration, Earth &amp; Environment Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul> \n       <li><p>Operating and maintaining environmental remediation systems such as water treatment systems and soil vapor extraction systems.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Conduct monitoring events that include following standards and procedures for sampling of groundwater, soil gas, soil, sediment, stormwater, and surface water.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Supervising the drilling and installation of groundwater monitoring wells and geologic logging of soils during drilling and site environmental investigations.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Perform field measurements and calculations.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Record and compile field data using tablets and field meters.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Ensure the safety and health of yourself, WSP employees, and their on-site contractors; and protect the environment in which we work.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Equipment calibration, maintenance and repair.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Perform assigned office duties, such as data entry, processing borehole logs, presenting data, and supporting report preparation.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Coordinate and communicate with client representatives, subcontractors, homeowners, and WSP employees.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n       <li><p>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><br> <b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High school diploma<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Three years of relevant experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to pass a HAZWOPER physical.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to independently complete field assignments and summarize field data for use in reporting<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient MS Office skills and data collection tablets<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to safely lift 40 pounds<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong commitment to safety, including following established Health and Safety protocols<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong initiative, problem-solving and communication skills, and attention to detail<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Good verbal and written communication skills and a professional attitude<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Willingness to travel for field assignments as dictated by project demands (including to remote locations and outside work in various climates up to 50% of time)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Working outdoors in all weather conditions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Two-year technical degree in the field of engineering, environmental sciences, geology, or related discipline<\u002Fli> \n       <li>40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Hands-on field experience, including familiarity\u002Fexperience with maintenance of remediation systems, groundwater and soil sampling techniques and field procedures<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Should be mechanically inclined and self-motivated<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Compensation and Benefits:<br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $44,000 - $79,200<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <p>#LI-AC2<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 50%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>REDMOND - NE UNION HILL RD<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-WA-Redmond<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Assistant Vice President, National Marketing and Communications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for an <b>Assistant Vice President, National Business Line Marketing and Communications<\u002Fb> to be located in any of our offices in the U.S.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, you’ll find yourself challenged in more fascinating and far-reaching ways than ever before. You’ll explore new and inspiring opportunities to make the most of your expertise, broaden your professional horizons and create exciting new possibilities for people, organizations and society in general.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> With close collaboration with the National Business Line (NBL) Executives and Senior Vice President of Marketing and Communications, this role will support two of our critically important NBLs - Advisory and Property and Buildings - supporting growth goals and will be responsible for planning, developing and implementing related marketing and communication plans and strategies. Through the execution of both internal and external communications aimed primarily at enhancing the reputation of the NBLs and supporting retention and recruitment efforts, as well as marketing and communications activities that create opportunities for deeper client engagement. You will collaborate with and have support from the marketing and communications team, including internal communications, media relations, digital marketing and marketing execution team. You will work across the marketing and communications team and the business to develop cross-cutting campaigns and align marketing plans.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Ideally, you will have experience of working within a matrixed environment and executing regional communications plans that align global and regional priorities.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> A core objective will be raising our brand profile and with key client groups, driving thought leadership out of the business in a variety of contexts, engaging our employees through interesting and enjoyable internal campaigns.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> You will need to be strategic, passionate and innovative in order to successfully deliver results for the business. You will be confident to chair stakeholder meetings and pitch new ideas in a persuasive and engaging manner clearly articulating the benefits. You will build strong relationships with internal and external clients and deliver projects to a high standard.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Working closely with the NBL executives and national leadership teams you will develop a marketing and communications plan and execute through successful delivery.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Key Tasks and Responsibilities<\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Develop an integrated external and internal marketing and communication strategy to support the Advisory and Property &amp; Buildings business strategy that underpins business growth, including raising profile &amp; awareness, establishing a market position, increasing revenues &amp; margins, balancing service portfolios and supporting employee experience and engagement (retention, recruitment, on-boarding, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Engage key business stakeholders in the development, adaptation and implementation of the Advisory and Property &amp; Buildings and communications strategy.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Liaise with NBL and region marketing and communications counterparts teams to ensure alignment across plans and campaigns, leverage activities and ensure consistency of messaging across channels and audience groups.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Working with event leaders, oversee and support key events to raise brand profile of Advisory and Property &amp; Buildings and maximizing ROI.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Engaging on relevant\u002Fidentified global marketing initiatives and determine appropriate execution for U.S. clients and stakeholders<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Identify global content that can be leveraged in the U.S. to relevant audiences e.g. client impact stories, points of view, thought leadership.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide strategic counsel to senior leaders across WSP Advisory and Property &amp; Buildings region to help achieve the objectives of their client engagement and marketing projects and programs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide strategic marketing advice on best to approach key commercial and business priorities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support the president of Advisory and Property &amp; Buildings with internal communications and engagement activities, working closely with the internal comms director.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Advise on reputational issues within the Sector, working closely with the media relations team.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Help develop annual budget for advertising and marketing events, memberships, and subscriptions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Promote collaboration across team.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Share best practices and drive consistency in approach and quality.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide feedback to feed into annual performance review process for team and support efforts to attract and retain top talent.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Drive brand standards, to create high-quality and consistency of WSP’s professional image in all client communications, proposals, and other related collateral.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ensure feedback mechanisms and data analytics are in place to monitor audience engagement and ROI, adjusting communication approaches as necessary and fostering an environment of continuous improvement.<br> <\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <p> Job Knowledge, Skills &amp; Experience<\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>10+ years of experience in leading and implementing marketing &amp; communications strategies, preferably within a professional services environment (or other relevant sector)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong interpersonal skills and significant experience in working with senior leadership teams and other key stakeholders<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrable track record of successful project delivery and project management with multiple stakeholders<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Extensive experience of engaging clients through the full marketing mix<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Expert verbal and written communication skills with proven credentials and examples<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong knowledge and abilities to use multiple platforms and channels (including digital) for a range of audiences<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong knowledge of marketing and communication technologies and tools<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent project management skills, analytical and business acumen<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong people coordination and management skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Passion for using marketing to solve problems and a natural curiosity<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Solid organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects in parallel – to time and budget<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Clear understanding of business needs, priorities and where to allocate marketing spend for the best returns<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Personal Qualities<\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Strong influencing skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Clear and creative thinker<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Results driven<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Resourceful and self-motivated to drive and develop projects and campaigns from scratch<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Able to cope well under pressure and in a changing environment;<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with people of all levels.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comfortable working remotely with a team spread across different offices and within a matrix organization<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Will work to accommodate time zones at times<\u002Fli> \n       <li>An appetite for learning and trying new approaches<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>About WSP USA<br> <br> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the transportation, buildings, energy, water and environment sectors. With nearly 15,500 people in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com\u002Fusa<br> <br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<br> <br> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be a key piece in our meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<br> <br> WSP USA (and all of its US companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual Orientation\u002FGender Identity\u002FNational Origin\u002FDisability or Protected Veteran Status.<br> <br> The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Compensation and Benefits<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $89,500 - $182,400<br> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. Successful candidate will be involved in providing editorial services nationally as part of our Visualization &amp; Data Intelligence team, a growing national specialty practice focused on advancing and enhancing the quality of all WSP deliverables. This position is responsible for providing technical editing with our Editorial Services group, to deliver publication-quality documents. Our successful candidate will have experience working in the fast-paced professional services industry across a broad range of market sectors.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring the right people to be part of our future-focused business objectives and mission-driven professional services projects that are embracing new and emerging technology. Our devotion to teamwork has allowed us to build communities and expand our skylines. Here at WSP, anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Provide editorial support to technical\u002Fengineering\u002Fprofessional services, which includes technical white papers and reports, grants and proposals, and educational and public-engagement outreach materials.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Edit and proof technical documentation, and produce final documents.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Revise highly technical content into more easily understood language that communicates technical information to a variety of audiences.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Adhere to quality control plans for document deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Adhere to schedules and budgets and meet tight deadlines.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor's degree in English, Communications Arts, Graphic Arts or related field of study<\u002Fli> \n       <li>3-5+ years industry experience with technical\u002Fengineering\u002Fprofessional services<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient in MS Office software (especially MS Word and the use of styles\u002Ftemplates)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledgeable in Associated Press Stylebook, Chicago Manual of Style, and other industry recognized guidelines • Ability to read\u002Funderstand highly technical documents and the English language<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with the document production process from initial design to final print (for electronic and print media)and publication principles and concepts<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Able to exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds and resources, and conduct and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety, and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (including Adobe InDesign)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficiency in document and media accessibility standards (WCAG, Section 508, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Industry-recognized editorial certification<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb><br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $75,000 - $92,000<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change. As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP Solutions is currently seeking a Water Resources Intern to support our Water Resources\u002FPermitting\u002FCompliance Service Line in Columbia, South Carolina<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support various projects within our Water Resources\u002FPermitting\u002FCompliance Service Line, including stormwater \u002F MS4 support, watershed planning and environmental permitting projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Conduct field investigations including stormwater infrastructure inventory \u002F condition assessment, erosion and sediment control inspections and surface water sampling events in various site settings<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Conduct public education, including environmental education in schools, educational workshops and at local festivals<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist senior staff with the preparation of technical reports, including compiling analytical data<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Some travel \u002F field work (daytime and overnight) may be required (typically in South Carolina.)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with a team of water resources engineers and environmental scientists<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work outdoors in various weather conditions<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Ideal candidates will be working We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Earth &amp; Environment Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Environmental Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our<b> New York, NY<\u002Fb> or<b> Valhalla, NY<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Environmental Science\u002FEngineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship<\u002Fli> \n WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. Be involved in projects with our <b>Transportation Team <\u002Fb>and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP is looking to build our <b>Traffic and Tolling team<\u002Fb> in the <b>Bay Area<\u002Fb>. Join our team as a <b>Tolling Lead and Project Manager<\u002Fb> and help shape the future of Bay Area transportation.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Responsible for the pursuit and development of business and the successful execution of work; lead technical aspects of contract negotiation and presentations.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide guidance and leadership to mid-level to senior level team or project members, with strict adherence to QA\u002FQC.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Responsible for the profitable performance of the individual projects and the successful completion of the projects within the specified area.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Communicate high-level engineering concepts regarding transportation projects and issues, and effectively communicate, both orally and in writing.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide proactive and strategic leadership offering direction, expertise, and support tothe Traffic team to ensure project deliverables are successfully achieved<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop a client base for providing high level tolling services including identifying additional business development opportunities, and cross-selling of other WSP capabilities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Conduct needs analyses and client value surveys to align the engineering discipline’s function with business and project strategy, identifying and addressing any skill gaps or risks within the sector business operations.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, or closely related discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>12+ years of relevant post education experience in traffic, tolling or engineering infrastructure design.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Registered Engineer license (CA) required.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Advanced proficiency with civil engineering principles, practices, process, design\u002Fbuild, standard of care, and the application to permitting and project work-related issues.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>A broad depth of experience with managed lanes or similar projects with thorough knowledge of required tasks and deliverables associated with each project phase; specifically, knowledge of the process for systems design and integration, field testing, implementation, and project delivery issues; knowledge of the environmental process, design standards and practices, cost estimating, and construction management principles and practices.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of advanced principles and practices of civil engineering and\u002For system integration as applied to the design, cost estimating, budgeting, construction, installation, and inspection of a wide variety of traffic and congestion management systems, including express lane corridor design and operations.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with employee supervision, including work planning, assignments, performance evaluations, and training staff in work procedures and the ability to mentor staff to support their growth and professional development.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Tactical lateral thinking and strong analytical skills with attention to detail and prioritization of responsibilities in a pressure work environment.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Compensation and Benefits:<br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Scheduler<\u002Fb> that can work <b>remotely <\u002Fb>or out of our <b>Atlanta, GA or out of any major U.S. office<\u002Fb>. Be involved in projects with our <b>Project Controls Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Strong collaborative scheduling, forecasting and analysis leader for assigned project manager (PM).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Responsible for developing, updating and analyzing detailed execution schedules in Primavera P6.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop and implement monthly schedule updates and variance reports in accordance with Client process and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Co-manage with the PM key schedule activities that control the overall construction time or the critical path.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assess contractor monthly schedule updates and support analysis of potential delay claims and change orders.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform time impact analyses (TIA) and forensic delay analysis to determine the extent of the impacts of potential delays during construction<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Identify and measure scope change impact on a project schedule(s).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Identify and support risk mitigation plans.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Recommend and support execution of schedule, scope change or delay solutions for the Project Team and Program Leadership.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Talent is the essence of meeting our client’s objectives, goals and challenges. If this sounds like a fit for you, we’d love to have that first discussion of you joining our team.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor's Degree<\u002Fli> \n       <li>3-5 years experience in developing and managing complex, multi-contractor project Schedules.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Utility capital Transmission and Distribution projects experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experienced with critical path method analysis\u002Ftechnique with Primavera.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Project financial forecasting skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Implementation of Risk Management techniques.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Change Order and Extension of Time analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience managing\u002F leading cross-functional teams.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience working within large and challenging Client Programs with one or more project teams.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Effective reporting and communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience in preparing high level project reports and documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP's health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Infrastructure Projects including DPW, Utilities and Bridges\u002For Project Management experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Team player and Strong communication skills<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb><br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<br> Expected Salary:$74,900 - $148,500<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Earth &amp; Environment Team is seeking a <b>Senior Summer 2023 Environmental Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>New York, NY <\u002Fb>or <b>Valhalla, NY<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Conduct project research and data gathering; contribute to mapping, graphic production, and site reconnaissance.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Environmental Science\u002FEngineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n Science, Environmental Engineering, or related, Masters or PhD program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in Environmental Science\u002FEngineering, or related field, and have a strong professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Early Career Geologist<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for an <b>Early Career Geologist<\u002Fb> for our <b>Roseville, CA<\u002Fb> office. From this location, our team of geo-professionals provides services to clients in the solid waste, aggregates, mining, transportation, and manufacturing sectors.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This position provides an opportunity to join a fast-paced team that provides solutions on geological, civil, and environmental projects. The work entails a variety of office-related and field activities, with a need to carefully follow instructions, document activities, solve problems, and provide proactive communication.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Collect, extract, identify, and compile environmental data from soil sampling, soil gas sampling, groundwater sampling, stormwater sampling, boring logs, and other matrices for projects, investigations, and surveys.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform subsurface field geologic exploration tasks including drilling oversight, soil logging, and test pit explorations.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Install monitoring wells for groundwater sampling and water level readings.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Interpretation of subsurface conditions and preparation of boring logs and well construction details.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform oversight of remediation subcontractors.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide peer review of staff deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Install and collect data from slope monitoring instrumentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform data compilation, report writing, GIS data analysis, and other related duties to support project teams.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Local and national travel (up to 50% of the time) with possible short and long-term assignments at project sites.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Safely perform work in the office and field; fieldwork may occur in all seasonal weather conditions, while using equipment (with an ability to lift and move approximately 40 pounds without assistance) and operating vehicles on behalf of the company.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Geology, Hydrogeology, or closely related discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0-1 years of relevant work experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent research skills with analytical mindset.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with the concepts of reducing and eliminating the use or generation of hazardous substances, processes, or products.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with relevant environmental laws, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to a scientific and non-scientific audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently under general supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation and communication software, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Master’s degree is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>40-Hour OSHA Health &amp; Safety Training (HAZWOPER) (29 CFR 1910.120) preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with field-based data collection applications.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb><br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $53,200 - $93,000<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-GD1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 50%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> New Graduate<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>ROSEVILLE - ENTERPRISE WAY<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-CA-Rancho Cordova, US-CA-Roseville<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change. As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently seeking an Environmental Scientist to join our team in Albany, NY, Bayside, NY, or Rocky Hill, CT offices. For this position we expect to train the successful applicant in appropriate field methods and procedures and therefore prior experience or training is not required, although still a positive. WSP will also provide required OSHA health and safety training prior to field work. That person will gain experience in writing work plans, analyzing and evaluating environmental data and assisting with report preparation for submittal to our clients and regulatory agencies.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Oversee soil borings and groundwater monitoring well installations, collect soil, groundwater, surface water, sediment, air, and soil gas samples, collect data in complex field situations with supervision, and document field activities<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform other field exploration, inspection, testing, and analyses using equipment and instrumentation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare components of site investigation reports including work plans, data summaries, calculations, tables, figures, charts, drawings and report text<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Collect samples and data during remedies and pilot studies from soil and groundwater remediation systems<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist Project Managers and project teams, ensuring effective client communication and relations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Organize field work, assign tasks, and work with other staff specialists and technicians to complete assignments<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follow company safety policies and procedures, site safety standards, and permit requirements<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>BS or BA in Geology, Environmental Science or Engineering, or related technical field<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong writing skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Effective verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Valid New York Class \"D\" Drivers License or Equalivant<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must have personal transportation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Physical Demands: Ability to remain on feet for extended periods of time either stationary or walking<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Field activities may require working in unfavorable weather conditions, including heat and cold<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to lift 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-SS2<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 70%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>BAYSIDE - NORTHERN BLVD<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-CT-Rocky Hill, US-NY-Albany, US-NY-Bayside, US-NY-Clifton Park<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Full-Time Construction Inspector<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>for our <b>Detroit, Michigan<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>office. Be involved in projects with our<b> <\u002Fb><b>PM\u002FCM Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Assist with collecting, compiling, and analyzing data from the physical work site, surveys, structural plans, blueprints, schematics, data, technical drawings, flow diagrams, material sampling, computer-generated reports, and other matrices for field inspection activities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Under minimal supervision, use survey instruments, metering devices, and test equipment to perform basic inspections of proposed and existing site conditions, equipment, construction, materials, controls, resources, layout, alignment, and elevation to determine conformance with applicable rules, standards, codes, and construction or operating permits.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide routine technical assistance that accounts for the proper inspection, construction, and functioning of buildings, highways, roads, bridges, structures, infrastructure, equipment, and\u002For mechanical systems according to design standard specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with verifying load calculations, change orders, interpretation of contract plans and specifications, recognizing basic construction, engineering, or survey problems and escalating any differences, errors, or technical problems for appropriate resolution.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Attend pre-construction meetings and assist with answering questions from contractors and other attendees.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with calculating payments due to contractors for work completed.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with ensuring adequate levels of equipment and materials are assigned to projects, ensuring that material tests are performed, and materials meet required standards.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Generate complete, accurate, and concise documentation and specifications related to inspection findings using electronic systems, written\u002Foral feedback, photographs, drawings, diagrams, illustrations, spreadsheets, and reports.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comply with client policies and procedures for inspection work under contract.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comply with safety guidelines and site-specific procedures which include but are not limited to, location data, statistical documentation, studies and surveys, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exhibit basic knowledge of current field inspection practices.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work collaboratively with other professionals, scientists, engineers, inspectors, project control, and technicians on assigned inspection phases, checks, and tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-TD1<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High School Diploma.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Minimum of 5 years of relevant post education experience in discipline with prior construction inspection experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Valid state driver’s license.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Highly familiar with construction inspection principles, field inspection practices, process, methods and techniques.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Highly familiar with relevant construction codes, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Sound interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to a technical and non-technical audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Sound self-leadership with attention to detail, accuracy, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, follow instruction, and comply with company policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Analytical mindset to exercise sound judgement in evaluating situations and making decisions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, technology, spreadsheets, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to provide input and feedback to others in the field such as subcontractors and work colleagues to consistently complete tasks safely, efficiently, and accurately according to specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Associate’s Degree in closely related discipline is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Essential professional licensure\u002Fcertification.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>DETROIT - GRISWOLD ST<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-MI-Detroit<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Be involved in projects with our <b>Project Controls Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Strong collaborative scheduling, forecasting and analysis leader for assigned project manager (PM).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Responsible for developing, updating and analyzing detailed execution schedules in Primavera P6.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop and implement monthly schedule updates and variance reports in accordance with Client process and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Co-manage with the PM key schedule activities that control the overall construction time or the critical path.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assess contractor monthly schedule updates and support analysis of potential delay claims and change orders.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform time impact analyses (TIA) and forensic delay analysis to determine the extent of the impacts of potential delays during construction<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Identify and measure scope change impact on a project schedule(s).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Identify and support risk mitigation plans.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Recommend and support execution of schedule, scope change or delay solutions for the Project Team and Program Leadership.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Schedules.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experienced with critical path method analysis\u002Ftechnique with Primavera.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Project financial forecasting skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Change Order and Extension of Time analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience managing\u002F leading cross-functional teams.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience working within large and challenging Client Programs with one or more project teams.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Effective reporting and communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience in preparing high level project reports and documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP's health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Transportation Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Bridge Inspection Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Valhalla, NY<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n Inspection.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Actively enrolled in an
