WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Combined we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Our Earth &amp; Environment Team is seeking a <b>Summer 2023 Civil Engineering Intern<\u002Fb> to work out of our <b>Roseville, CA<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Learn basic principles of Civil Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional Civil\u002FEnvironmental Engineering or related Undergraduate program.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated interest in civil, environmental or geotechnical engineering or related field and have a and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.<\u002Fli> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Survey Party Chief<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is initiating a search for a <b>Survey Party Chief<\u002Fb> to join our <b>Charlotte, Raleigh, or<\u002Fb> <b>Mooresville, NC<\u002Fb> location. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with an exceptional management team, highly regarded in the market, and within a supportive and collaborative company culture. This is an exceptional opportunity to join a robust and rapidly growing Survey team offering ongoing training\u002Fmentoring and promotional opportunities, as well as a stable backlog of mainly local work requiring minimal travel. <b>This team works with state of the art surveying equipment and offers flexible schedules including 10 hour day work schedule Monday thru Thursday.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <p> For information on our Geospatial team, follow this link - https:\u002F\u002Fvimeo.com\u002F390798645\u002Ff3e8decde8<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Supervise Survey Crew (1-2 staff crews)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Keep accurate, organized and complete field notes<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Communicate with office staff on daily basis<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Operate and maintain robotic instrument, total stations, sdata collector, GPS (fast static, RTK and VRS), digital levels<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Use and obtain historical data from property\u002Futility records, deeds, land\u002Fproperty titles, structural plans, and other matrices for land surveying activities<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follows state specific standards of practice to provide professional survey assistance that accounts for accurate survey data, and determines conformance with applicable rules, standards, codes, boundaries, and construction specifications<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with writing surveying reports summarizing site inspection and survey findings and conclusions; generating complete, accurate, and concise documentation using photographs, sketches, calculations, software, spreadsheets, technical drawings, 2D\u002F3D illustrations, and reports<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work collaboratively with other professionals, engineers, scientists, project control, and technicians on assigned survey tasks<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform weekly instruments calibrations in order to maintain their accuracy<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ensure that both you and your crews comply daily with WSP and client specific safety guidelines and provide required safety documentation and records<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Engage in occasional contact with client personnel to schedule and coordinate project survey activities<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Remain current in latest survey knowledge, techniques, and practices<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High School Diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n       <li>7+ years of relevant post education experience in discipline with prior surveying experience with easements, rights of way, plats, topographic surveys, boundary surveys, property descriptions, and GPS surveys<\u002Fli> \n       <li>5+ Years of experience as a survey party chief<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent communication skills, field note taking, good math skills, ability to work as a one-person crew as necessary<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to lift up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Physically mobile in and around construction sites and field assignments<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to carry survey equipment and supplies in remote, rural or urban surroundings<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with both public and private sector work (e.g. state, city, county, utility districts, and private land development)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening, including a valid Driver's license<\u002Fli> <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Document Control Specialist<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Document Control Specialist<\u002Fb> for our <b>Houston, TX<\u002Fb> office. Be involved in projects with our <b>Energy Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <p> File, organize, proof, and submit all documents associated with assigned projects. Projects can range from drilling, construction, engineering design, permitting, well workover operations, and mechanical integrity testing (MIT). Documents include, but are not limited to, end of well reports, engineering specifications, MIT reports, permit applications, drawings, meeting minutes, construction close out documents, contracts, certificates of insurance, etc. In addition to supporting the projects with contract and insurance help, the position will be responsible to update and maintain the contract data base as well as, participate in the annual renewal of insurance certificates.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Job Duties include:<\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Filing relevant documents in electronic files and\u002For offsite storage warehouses.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Recording meeting minutes and submitting to stakeholders.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assemble and file well reports with all required information (logs, test reports, etc)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist engineers in obtaining appropriate specifications for engineering design.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>File and track drawing revisions and set up transmittals for deliverables to the client.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proofread and assist in the assembly of permitting documents, as needed.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with the legal department to update and maintain the contract data base based on new contracts, amendments, and renewals.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist the insurance group in the semiannual renewal of certificates of insurance, providing needed updates, if necessary.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform other document related tasks as directed by the Project Managers.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Skills required:<\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Attention to detail, reviewing for accuracy<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to multi-task<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Organizing and handling a large volume of documents<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Good working knowledge of Microsoft office and SharePoint<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>Skills preferred:<\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Knowledge of engineering and drilling specifications is a definite plus.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Contract and insurance experience is not required but is a plus.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of drawing specifications and revision procedures.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Minimal travel but occasional after-hours work will be required. Prefer local (Houston area, Park Row office) candidate as a minimum of 3 days in the office is required.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p> <\u002Fp>\n      <p>#LI-MC1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 25%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>HOUSTON - 16200 PARK ROW<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-TX-Houston<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change. As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is seeking a Survey Field Technician to join our dynamic and growing Survey-Geomatics team in Orlando, FL. Our local survey team has a professional services presence of 30+ years in Florida, professional mentors with a combined experience of 130 years. This is an opportunity to build a rewarding career that provides challenging opportunities and encourages you to excel, includes challenging work environments, unique survey project types and exciting locations.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Perform field work efforts for land surveying services of all types<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Operate survey total station, GNSS\u002FGPS and level instruments<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Record survey data in field books and\u002For data collector<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain field equipment in a clean and secure manner<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform pre-start vehicle checks to ensure operability, maintenance and safety<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with survey file processing and field calculations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work on several jobs simultaneously<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintain good client relations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Project Related Responsibilities:All facets of surveying projects including but not limited to: \n        <ul>\n         <li>Collection of record data for boundary surveys<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Establish project control monumentation<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Collection of topographic information for 3D mapping<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Coordinate with office staff<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Providing construction layout on WSP project<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>A minimum High School Diploma or GED<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Preference and additional compensation will be given to those with survey-geomatics experience, certifications or training such as the Certified Survey Technician (CST) program, but entry-level candidates are encouraged to apply<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Appropriate health and safety knowledge\u002Ftraining<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Good written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Superior organizational skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic computer skills and technical competence<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Commitment to take on the challenging work within the WSP organization<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to travel to project site for extended periods of time<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must pass drug test, background check and must have a satisfactory driving record in accordance with the Company's driving (MVR) policy<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Preference will be given to those familiar with utility locating<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Physical Demands<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n of hand-held equipment for extended periods is required<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to work in a field environment and have the ability to travel as required<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Takes part in providing local technical assistance for the due diligence, investigation, remediation, impact assessment, permitting, design, development, and construction of utility, industrial, and commercial scale projects in the public and private sector. Tasks may include basic assistance with the research, design, concept development, and construction of transmission and distribution substations, power distribution, power regulation, renewable energy, as well as protection and control systems in a wide variety of contexts (utilities, transportation, building, and Federal, State, and local government projects). Generates accurate and concise documentation regarding assigned aspects of the project. Ensures that responsibilities are delivered and adhered to with a level of quality that meets or exceeds acceptable industry standards for design, safety, and functionality.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Under general supervision, assist with collecting, compiling, and analyzing data relating to substation components, equipment specifications for procurement package development and pricing, IFR\u002FIRC design and review processes, and IEEE\u002FNESC Standards\u002FNERC regulations for design work.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with performing basic professional electrical engineering work relating to the design of single line, three line, wiring diagrams, general arrangement, substation layout and bus arrangement, grounding grid design and lightning protection in conformance with applicable rules, standards, and construction or operating permits.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform routine engineering functions and provide entry-level technical assistance on various design requirements, equipment sizing and cabling, AC\u002FDC panel design, and conduit and trenching design strategies to account for the safety and functionality of end-users, systems, and infrastructure.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with verifying the characteristics of a site and providing basic technical assistance on engineering, design, testing, maintenance, and construction procedures and issues.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Under close supervision, develop electrical calculations for loads, equipment sizing, feeder sizing, voltage drop, grounding, lighting circuits and controls, facility and electrical service, and power distribution.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Generate complete, accurate, and concise documentation using electronic systems, drawings, and field\u002Fwork site notebook\u002Flogs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comply with safety guidelines and site-specific procedures which include but are not limited to, location data, statistical documentation, engineering studies and surveys, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0 to 1 years of relevant post education experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent research skills with analytical mindset.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>General understanding of electrical engineering as applied in design engineering of large capital projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with relevant engineering and electrical construction laws, codes, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently under general supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with discipline-specific design software (i.e., CADD, Aspen, and CAPE), AutoCADD electrical.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Engineer in Training Certification.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship related to the degree of study and the specific engineering discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>A member of and\u002For actively participate in local professional practice organizations.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-MS1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> New Graduate<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>DALLAS - OAK LAWN AVE<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-TX-Dallas<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Survey Technician II<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change. As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently seeking a Survey Technician to join our team in Nashville, TN. This is technical field and office work assisting in land survey projects. An employee in this class operates various land survey instruments while office duties include a variety of technical and clerical tasks. Applicant will perform assignments under the direction of a supervisor and project technical staff.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Gathers field survey data through use of conventional and Global Positioning System (GPS) methods; sets up, adjusts, and operates surveying equipment, including electronic total station, data collector, and GPS equipment, in order to measure distances, elevations, and angles; prepares field notes and drawings; performs field surveying for roadway, bridges, railroads, stormwater, industrial facilities, and flood control projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Installs surveying construction stakes, tying out existing intersection ties, and locating or establishing vertical and horizontal control, right of way, monuments, corners, boundaries, and property lines<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Helps with the interpretation, and development, of construction drawings and associated computations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assumes supervision of the crew in the absence of the party chief<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepares sketch drawings from survey data, prepares notes and uses a computer and hand-held scientific calculator<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Performs minor adjustment and calibration of survey instruments and operates electronic measuring devices, (total stations), including electronic field books, (data collectors)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Enforce safety standards to maintain a safety culture where no accidents occur; Performs work in a safety conscious manner to self and to coworkers and subcontractors<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Performs related work as required<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Minimum two (2) years experience in land survey work preferred but not required; or an equivalent combination of education, training or experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be willing to travel as needed, including overnight stays when out of town<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Possession and maintenance of a valid Driver License<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of general construction principles and practices<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of the techniques and practices of land surveying<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of some advanced mathematics<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Skilled in the use of land survey instruments and equipment<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to read and interpret specifications, maps and construction drawings<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to make routine surveying computations quickly and accurately<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of construction specifications, plans, and regulations relating to construction and higher level mathematical applications to survey computations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to operate motorized equipment and possession of sufficient physical stamina to work long hours outdoors under various field conditions and exposure to traffic, extreme heat, cold and rainfall<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must pass drug test, background check and must have a satisfactory driving record in accordance with the Company's driving (MVR) policy<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-RR1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>NASHVILLE - WEST END AVE<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-TN-Nashville<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual Orientation\u002FGender Identity\u002FNational Origin\u002FDisability or Protected Veteran Status.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.<\u002Fp>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Part-Time Technician Assistant<\u002Fb> for our <b>New York, NY<\u002Fb> office. Be involved in projects with our Earth &amp; Environment Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To act as the company's asbestos technician representatives during asbestos abatements in designated work spaces in various industry sectors.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follow instruction from Project Managers and senior project monitors.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Monitor final air clearance during asbestos abatements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Collect PCM and TEM air samples and properly record chain of custodies, daily logs, and maintain involvement in project oversight and result reporting in fulfillment with assessment and monitoring requirements of asbestos abatements in compliance with Federal, State, and Local laws.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Position entails frequent travel throughout New York City, State, and Long Island. Reliable transportation, valid driver's license and good driving record required.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High school graduate<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0-2 yrs relevant work experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Good oral and written communication skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Willingness to work multiple shifts and varying hours, including nights and weekends<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must have own vehicle and a valid driver’s license.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must be able to pass a HAZWOPER physical and be medically able to wear a tight-fitting respirator.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>OSHA 10-hr\u002F30-hr Construction Certificate a plus<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Updated Fit Test and Medical Testing documents a plus<\u002Fli> \n       <li>40-Hour OSHA HAZWOPER<\u002Fli> \n       <li> At least two of the following licenses \n        <ul>\n         <li>NYS DOL Project Monitor<\u002Fli> \n         <li>NYS DOL Asbestos Sampling Technician<\u002Fli> \n         <li>OSHA 10-Hour Construction Safety and Health<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $38,000 - $68,400<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<br> #LI-BJ1<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 100%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Part<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>NEW YORK - PENN PLAZA<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-NY-New York<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. The position can be located within the Santa Cruz, South Bay, and San Francisco Bay Area. Be involved in projects with our <b>PMCM<\u002Fb> Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges. The position can be located within the San Francisco Bay Area, greater Sacramento area, or the Central Valley. WSP has offices in Antioch, Walnut Creek, San Francisco, Oakland, San Jose, Sacramento, Roseville, and Stockton. Projects may span multiple disciplines, such as roadway\u002Fhighway and transit\u002Frail construction.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Plans, reviews and assigns work of subordinate field or construction field office personnel<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Reviews construction processes and engineering layouts<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Reviews project activities with client and contractor’s field supervision resolving disputes and other daily issues<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Oversees materials testing activities<\u002Fli> \n responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-TD1<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> etc.)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>A minimum of 12 years of directly relevant experience, including Resident Engineer or related roles (or equivalent working knowledge\u002Fexperience).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>At least 5 years working as a Resident Engineer on Caltrans Highway improvement projects of similar size and complexity<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Professional Engineer (PE) \u002F Licensed Civil Engineer in the State of California.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>A demonstrated ability to read and completely understand contract documents<\u002Fli> \n       <li>A working knowledge of applicable codes, standards, and materials (e.g. Caltrans)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Effective oral and written communication skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Valid, current California Driver's license<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <p> The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.<\u002Fp> \n career. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Expected Salary: $125,200 - $255,400<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the equity and geographic location. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Graduate Mechanical Engineer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> Takes part in providing local technical assistance for the design, development, building, testing, and inspecting of mechanical systems on infrastructure, building, and construction projects in the public and private sector. Tasks may include basic assistance with the research, design, concept development, installation, operation, maintenance, and optimal integration of automatic temperature control, air distribution, hydronic, and plumbing systems, equipment and processes. Generates accurate and concise documentation regarding assigned aspects of the project. Ensures that responsibilities are delivered and adhered to with a level of quality that meets or exceeds acceptable industry standards for design, safety, and functionality.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <p> We are currently searching for <b>Graduate<\u002Fb> <b>Mechanical Engineers<\u002Fb> to join our <b>Tempe, AZ, Atlanta, GA, and Troy, NY<\u002Fb> offices.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Under general supervision, assist with collecting, compiling, and analyzing data from the physical work site, surveys, blueprints, schematics, data, technical drawings, computer-generated reports, and other matrices for project development, design, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with performing basic professional mechanical engineering work relating to conducting research and inspections of proposed and existing site conditions, equipment, resources, building, infrastructure, usage, and mechanical systems to determine conformance with applicable rules, standards, and construction or operating permits.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform routine engineering functions and provide entry-level technical assistance on various design requirements, load calculations, and operating strategies to account for the proper installation and functioning of equipment and systems according to specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Assist with verifying the characteristics of a site and providing basic technical assistance on various engineering, design, and construction issues.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Generate complete, accurate, and concise documentation and specifications using electronic systems, drawings, and field\u002Fwork site notebook\u002Flogs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Comply with safety guidelines and site-specific procedures which include but are not limited to, location data, statistical documentation, engineering studies and surveys, and construction.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Design air distributions systems and hydronic systems<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prepare cooling\u002Fheating load calculations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Schedule and select major equipment<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform construction administration tasks with oversight from experienced staff<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Survey and evaluate existing conditions with oversight from experienced staff<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, or closely related discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0 to 1 years of relevant post education experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent research skills with analytical mindset.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with process and concepts for design\u002Fbuild.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with relevant mechanical system and construction laws, codes, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently under general supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Familiarity with discipline-specific design software (i.e., AutoCAD, CAM).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Engineer in Training Certification.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship related to the degree of study and the specific engineering discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>A member of and\u002For actively participate in local professional practice organizations.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <p> Compensation and Benefits:<br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $50,900 - $91,700<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Early Career Power Engineer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for an <b>Early Career Power Engineer<\u002Fb> for our <b>Newark, NJ<\u002Fb> office. Be involved in projects with our <b>Energy Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> The Graduate Electrical Engineer will work under the leadership of Supervising Engineer. The Candidate is required to work within a multi-discipline team to design efficient and reliable high voltage substations. The engineer will coordinate his\u002Fher design activities to maintain project schedules and ensure successful project completion. The engineer will also assist the Estimating Team in preparation of estimates and project proposals.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> This position is accountable to provide the design activities in accordance with all applicable codes and standards, including all WSP’s policies and procedures, such as Safety, Environmental, Quality Assurance and Quality Control. Specific duties include:<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Work under mentorship and guidance of the Supervising Engineer.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Preparation of project specifications for material and equipment purchase and installation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Design of electrical substation facilities including site and bus work layouts, ground grids, controls, protection, and metering.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Delivery of accurate and thorough designs that will meet industry standards and specifications, and meet good engineering practice with excellent constructability.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Review of internal and external designs for code compliance, good design practice and constructability.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Resolving site queries, attending site meetings and performing site inspections during the construction phase of projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintaining complete project documentation with respect to substation design and construction, including all completion packages, as-built requirements and return data information.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Making and maintaining appropriate commitments to project teams and coordinating design activities with multi-disciplined project team members.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintaining good working relationships with internal groups that support projects.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Maintaining good working relationships with material suppliers, contractors, and any others that affect the quality, schedule and cost of projects.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Degree in Electrical Engineering from a recognized institution. Must provide the curriculum of Electric Power courses taken during the studies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0-1 years of experience related to Electrical Engineering<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Prior internship related to the Power\u002FEnergy Industry<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The ideal candidate must have successfully completed at<b> least two semesters<\u002Fb> of Power Courses in their college program. The following courses are required, but not limited to:<br> \n        <ul>\n         <li>Power Systems Analysis<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power System Relaying and Protection<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power System Stability and Control<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power System Transients<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power Systems Communications<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power Systems Instrumentation and Measurement. High voltage Instrument Transformers.<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power Systems Operations, Planning and Reliability<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Energy Development and Power Generation<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Transmission and Distribution Engineering<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Energy Management Systems<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power System Economics, Markets and Regulation<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Energy System Design<\u002Fli> \n         <li>High Voltage AC\u002FDC, FACTS<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Electric Machinery, Synchronous and Induction Machines<\u002Fli> \n         <li>High Voltage Engineering<\u002Fli> \n         <li>High Voltage Transformers<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Energy Conversion<\u002Fli> \n         <li>High Voltage Substations<\u002Fli> \n         <li>High Voltage Transmission Lines<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Industrial and Commercial Power Systems<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Motor Drives and Controls<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power Electronics<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Power Quality<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Photovoltaics, Wind, Renewables<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Smart Grids<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li>Eligible for P.E. license<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Candidate must undergo pre-employment drug screening and a criminal background investigation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Position located at client offices with travel to the site on occasion.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>A member of and\u002For actively participates in local professional practice organizations.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-MH4<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 10%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> New Graduate<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>NEWARK - GATEWAY CTR<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-NJ-Newark<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Customer Service Center Manager<\u002Fb> for our <b>Louisville, KY<\u002Fb> office.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The CSC Manager is responsible for managing functions associated with operating and delivering customer service for the <b>Customer Service Center<\u002Fb> and <b>Back Office System<\u002Fb> for <b>Ohio River Bridge Project<\u002Fb>. Duties include management of the Supervisors and the department annual labor and incentive budget. This position is full-time. Schedule will require sufficient visibility to entire staff throughout the month on all shifts. Job requires knowledge of MS Office, Windows, MS Excel, proficient typing skills, and excellent phone and customer service skills. Six Sigma experience is helpful. CSC Manager may be reassigned on a long term or temporary basis to another location, other shifts, or other schedules, to balance manpower or meet the needs of the company.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Brine Facility Operator<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> WSP USA is accepting applications for <b>Brine Facility Operators<\u002Fb> for a Solution Mining Operation in <b>Delta, Utah.<\u002Fb><br> <br> <\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>Duties and Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <p> The position posted is associated with WSP USA’s Cavern Solution Mining Operations. Candidates should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in an industrial facilities operations position. (All candidates: Please include a copy of your resume with your application.) Safety is a priority and is a primary consideration in everything that we do.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected contractual duration is from January 2023 to July 2025. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>The main responsibility is to operate and maintain the solution mining facility for ACES Delta I under contractual arrangement with WSP USA Inc in Delta, Utah.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Individuals will be responsible for safely operating all the components of the solution mining facility and performing regular, preventative maintenance of pumps, valves, control equipment, pipelines and similar equipment as needed, as well as some occasional reactive repair work.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The candidate will be required to work on a rotating shift to cover 24x7 operation. This candidate must be capable of following written instruction and procedures as well as verbal commands from the Lead Operator. The candidate should have good communication skills and will be expected to deal with operations personnel from other organizations as well as WSP customers and vendors.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Duties include making several daily rounds of Salt Cavern Wells and other related equipment to ensure proper operation and checking for faulty equipment, pipe leaks, malfunctioning pumps, valves, etc. Equipment operation such as starting, stopping, or adjusting speed of pumps as needed, valve alignment and general maintenance as well as entering data into WSP reporting system.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The candidate must adhere to established safety and operational procedures for the solution mining facility and follow all WSP internal protocols and procedures as well as for all environmental requirements. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>Individuals seeking this position should be comfortable working with computers using basic software for reporting. <\u002Fp>\n      <p>The position reports to the Facility Supervisor \u002F Lead Operator.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Physical Demands &amp; Work Environment:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Ability to lift, push and pull 75 pounds.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work in changing climate conditions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Able to work in close quarters, work while kneeling, squatting, sitting, climbing, and standing.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follow and adhere to all applicable Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) guidelines (ex: eye protection, footwear, FRC).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The employee frequently is required to stand, walk &amp; climb.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Use various hand tools and calibration equipment.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Minimum Qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li>2-5 years of field experience <\u002Fli>\n       <li>High School diploma or Equivalent experience <\u002Fli>\n       <li>General Computer skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Utah state driver’s license <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Available for rotating shifts as in days, nights, weekends, and holidays<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <p> · Basic Mechanical experience including fluid piping systems<\u002Fp> \n      <p> · Basic Electrical experience include troubleshooting and repair knowledge of pneumatic, electronic, and digital transmitters and controllers, switches, and other process instrumentation<\u002Fp> \n      <p> · Preventative Maintenance Programs experience<\u002Fp> \n      <p> · Equipment Operating and Rigging Certifications<\u002Fp> \n      <p> · Ideally, knowledge of ASME, API, and ANSI national codes #LI-MC1<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 25%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>BEAUMONT - SULPHUR DR<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-TX-Beaumont, US-TX-Houston, US-UT-Salt Lake City<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual Orientation\u002FGender Identity\u002FNational Origin\u002FDisability or Protected Veteran Status.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.<br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Mechanical Designer<\u002Fb> for our <b>Tucson, AZ<\u002Fb> office. Be involved in projects with our <b>Mining Process &amp; Infrasturcture Design Team<\u002Fb> and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Work closely with various Earth &amp; Environment Team staff in the design of mechanical and pipeline systems across the mining industry, including complex multi-discipline engineering projects;<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide design work to mechanical and pipeline systems, including design of mine process plant systems, pump stations, mechanical systems and associated facilities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Coordinate design activities with other multi-discipline project team members<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Be responsible for creating flow sheets and P&amp;IDs<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Be responsible for layout of process plants and process equipment with the ability to take flow sheets and P&amp;IDs and turn them into plant layouts<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Generate piping design and detail drawings including general arrangements, piping orthographics, isometrics, and pipe support detail drawings.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Daily use of AutoCAD and a range of 2D and 3D software packages<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with cross-functional teams in executing project work.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Complete training on assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Diploma \u002F Technical Certificate in Computer Aided Design (CAD) or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>7 years experience working in the mining sector or similar.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with AutoCAD (essential), AutoCAD Plant 3D (essential).<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with mechanical and piping arrangements and details<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Detail-oriented, highly organized with solid time management abilities;<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong interpersonal skills combined with a positive, team-oriented attitude;<\u002Fli> \n       <li>High level of personal integrity with a strong work ethic;<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Experience with Navisworks, Inventor, and Revit not essential but highly regarded<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience in other industrial process piping fields not essential but highly regarded<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Good problem solver with ability to identify alternative solutions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-MC2<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Candidates must be detail-oriented, focused, and organized with the ability to work independently and multitask effectively.
