<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Mine Closure Manager<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Our Business<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n      <p>We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change. <br> <br> As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Mine Closure Manager<\u002Fb> for our <b>US Mine Waste Group<\u002Fb>. The following locations will also be considered: <b>Reno, NV; Elko, NV; Albuquerque, NM; Denver, CO; Redmond, WA; Tucson, AZ; Phoenix, AZ.<\u002Fb> This position will provide leadership, technical direction, training, and management for multidisciplinary closure studies to ensure mine closure engineering and environmental subject matter, technical deliverables, and programs are delivered with a level of quality that meets or exceeds acceptable industry and company standards. The Mine Closure Manager should bring technical experience, knowledge in mine closure, and the talents, training, enthusiasm, strong communication skills and solutions-oriented focus to work as a valued and respected leader of our multidisciplinary closure team as we tackle some of the world’s most challenging environmental and mine life cycle problems by delivering relevant and cost-effective solutions to WSP’s global mining clients.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Lead large and complex mine closure projects by providing proactive and strategic leadership to closure technical discipline leaders as well as by offering direction, technical expertise in mine closure planning and design, and support to ensure project and deliverables are successfully achieved<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Build and enhance a multidisciplinary closure study and design team within WSP based on the unique talents, aspects, risks, and complexity of the study requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Lead the preparation of high-quality, multidisciplinary proposals and coordinate the preparation and submission of tender documents.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Lead negotiations and project risk evaluation, with support of legal counsel, to finalize and execute contracts.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Coordinate the setup of work packages, systems, routines, and controls to facilitate execution of studies, including the preparation of relevant study management documentation.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Ensure the allocation and availability of appropriate technical resources to complete required tasks and manage the interfaces across technical disciplines and business units.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Develop and execute post-closure monitoring and maintenance plans. Be able to adapt concurrent closure strategies to effectively make use of “lessons learned” and optimize closure strategies for different facilities and sites.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Ensure technical deliverables are reviewed and approved by senior technical reviewers with the required qualifications and experience within the study technical discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Lead the tracking and reporting of project progress against schedule and budget as per client and WSP requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Act as the company representative and liaise with the client representative with respect to study progress and deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Schedule project discipline meetings, providing updates and recommendations to ensure that all reasonable and proper measures are taken to inculcate discipline expertise and innovation into project work.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Provide verbal and\u002For written inputs to multidisciplinary project teams and contribute to providing high level strategic advice to clients . <\u002Fli> \n       <li>Mentor junior task managers and project engineers\u002Fscientists to develop future study management capacity.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Attend and present at conferences to promote the WSP brand and support development of our closure practice.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Demonstrate leadership in safety and sustainability management across study activities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Support the identification, positioning, and planning for future mine closure opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources, and conduct, and adhere to WSP's Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li> Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor's Degree in Mining, Geological, Civil, Geotechnical, or other earth science or engineering technical related disciplines.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>12+ years of relevant post-education professional experience in engineering or earth science with a minimum of 5+ years of relevant experience related to mine closure planning and design.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ideally over 5 years of consulting experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated significant experience and provable success in leading study management, preferably with large and multidisciplinary mine closure studies and designs<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated experience in presenting complex information and recommendations to project client’s teams.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Significant knowledge of mining phase project definitions and scopes from planning and design, construction, operations, closure, and post-closure.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Works independently and provides guidance and leadership to mid-level to senior level team or project members.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Independent thinker able to develop new ideas and promote environmentally sustainable engineering solutions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent leadership and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to interact with employees effectively, persuasively, and tactfully at all levels of the organization.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>A commitment to diversity, environment, health, safety, and society.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Tactical lateral thinking and strong analytical skills with attention to detail and prioritization of responsibilities in a pressure work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of sources, including senior management, clients, regulators, and company-wide staff, including those with whom no formal hierarchical relationship exits. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by our client’s and WSP's health, safety, environmental, and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong ability to quickly adapt to change and demonstrate flexibility to a variety of schedules and hours to meet business needs.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements. <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Master’s Degree or higher in any engineering or environmental science discipline.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Essential Licenses (e.g., PE, PG) as applicable and\u002For enhancing credentials and certifciations.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Strong experience in managing the review and approval of documents and discipline-specific deliverables, certifications, processes, and plans in a multi-project environment.<br> <br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b>Compensation and Benefits<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n      <p>WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career. Expected Salary: 111,000-226,500<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant's education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant's sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp>\n      <br> \n      <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 10%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>LAKEWOOD - W ALASKA DR<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-AZ-Phoenix, US-AZ-Tucson, US-NM-Albuquerque, US-NV-Elko, US-NV-Reno, US-WA-Redmond<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. <li>Produce reports on documentation and progress as requested<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li>Perform reoccurring training on Document Management Requirements and EDMS use. \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Power Studies Engineer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> KEEP THE INTERNET RUNNING AND THE WORLD WORKING! At kW Mission Critical Engineering, a part of WSP USA, that’s exactly what we do.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Simply, data centers are buildings that store information technology. These mission critical facilities must remain operational 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Your role is to design the building infrastructure—power and cooling systems—to make sure that happens.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Be a part of an engineering team where from day one, you will collaborate and add value to every project. Gain invaluable experience early in your career. Not only will you be designing building systems, you’ll interact with all internal mechanical, electrical, plumbing, fire protection, and telecommunication engineers, external design partners like architects and structural engineers, and equipment vendors for the development of drawings and specifications. Then, travel to project locations during construction and watch your designs being built for some of the largest companies in the world.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Do you want to work on innovative, award-winning projects, travel and see your designs being built, and enjoy an occasional game of ping-pong, lunch and learn, or after-hours’ camaraderie? Are you looking for career growth? Join our great people at our great places designing great projects.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> kW Mission Critical Engineering is currently initiating a search for a <b>Power Studies Engineer<\u002Fb> for our <b>Milwaukee, WI<\u002Fb> office<\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> As a Power Studies Engineer with us, you will develop and refine your skills in model building, data entry (cables and feeders as well as circuit breakers and relays), circuit breaker selective coordination (TCCs) and arch flash analysis. You’ll use these skills to contribute to larger projects, involving generator plants, medium voltage distribution, and uninterruptible power systems and to compile your findings into final reports for project leads.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Perform preliminary short circuit calculations to validate equipment ratings during design<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Build power system models which accurately reflect designed and constructed systems<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform medium and low voltage coordination studies to develop optimum protective relay and breaker settings balancing safety and operational reliability<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Evaluate submitted equipment for capability to withstand available fault current at points throughout the distribution system<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform arc flash studies in compliance with NFPA and industry standards<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Generate short circuit, coordination, and arc flash study reports, along with arc flash labels<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Coordinate with internal design leads and clients to obtain required information, discuss options, and develop solutions<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> The ideal candidate enjoys performing analytical calculations and thinking analytical about data. A background in physics or engineering is preferred as well as experience in building design or power studies.<\u002Fp> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or Physics<\u002Fli> \n       <li>0 to 1 years of relevant post education experience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to listen to client needs, engage with design team members, and drive project beyond expectations<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Knowledge of building codes, NFPA 70 &amp; 70E, and IEEE 1584<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Protective relaying design experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Internship in building design or power studies<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Large scale facilities or Mission Critical\u002FData Center experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with power studies tools (SKM, ETAP, etc)<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> 20%<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>MILWAUKEE - N WATER ST<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-WI-Milwaukee<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race\u002FAge\u002FColor\u002FReligion\u002FSex\u002FSexual <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Construction Inspector<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is currently initiating a search for a <b>Full-Time Construction Inspector<\u002Fb> for our <b>Antioch, California <\u002Fb>office. The following locations will also be considered: Oakland, San Francisco and San Jose. Be involved in projects with our <b>PMCM <\u002Fb>Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges. WSP has offices in Antioch, Walnut Creek, San Francisco, Oakland, San Jose, Sacramento, Roseville, and Stockton.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Read and interpret project plans and specifications<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Monitor construction for compliance with project documents<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Measure, calculate, and document quantities of installed materials in accordance with client policies and procedures<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Inspect road and bridge construction (based on Caltrans Standards)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Review, inspect, and approve traffic control systems, including lane closures, in accordance with Caltrans’ standards and requirements<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p>#LI-TD1<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> <b>Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>High School Diploma.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Five (5) years of inspection experience in highway\u002Fbridge\u002Fpublic works industry OR 5 years of experience in the highway\u002Fpublic works sector working for a contractor or public agency<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Knowledge of Caltrans Standard Plans, Standard Specifications, and Construction Manual.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Valid California driver’s license.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Highly familiar with construction inspection principles, field inspection practices, process, methods and techniques.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Highly familiar with relevant construction codes, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Sound interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to a technical and non-technical audience.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Sound self-leadership with attention to detail, accuracy, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, follow instruction, and comply with company policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Analytical mindset to exercise sound judgement in evaluating situations and making decisions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, technology, spreadsheets, and tools.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to provide input and feedback to others in the field such as subcontractors and work colleagues to consistently complete tasks safely, efficiently, and accurately according to specifications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug\u002Falcohol and harassment policies.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b>Preferred Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Associate’s Degree in closely related discipline<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Two (2) years of education equivalent to completion of a curriculum beyond the 12th grade in either (1) engineering which includes courses in trigonometry and algebra or higher, drafting, computer science, and physics, chemistry, or a comparable physical science; or (2) surveying which includes courses in trigonometry and algebra or higher, drafting, surveying, and computer science.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Essential professional licensure\u002Fcertification.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n      <p>WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $51,000- $92,000, depending on experience level, location and other qualifications. Employee's hourly rate may increase if\u002Fwhen they perform services that are covered by California's Prevailing Wage laws on public sector projects, or are covred by other applicable wage and hour laws.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>ANTIOCH - LONE TREE WAY<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-CA-Oakland, US-CA-San Francisco, US-CA-San Jose<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Environmental Engineering Lead<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n     <br> \n     <p><\u002Fp> \n     <div> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who We Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<\u002Fp> \n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment &amp; Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency &amp; sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change. As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> This Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP is seeking an Environmental Engineering Lead with a minimum of 15 years of consulting experience to join our Northwest environmental investigation and restoration consulting team and lead our environmental engineering practice. The ideal candidate will be excited about the opportunity to maintain and grow our remediation and EHS consulting practice in a collegial, collaborative environment, and possess knowledge and technical skills in site investigation and remediation under Federal and State (Oregon, Washington, Alaska, and Idaho) regulations, with a preference for extensive experience with MTCA. Experience with Federal Government (Department of Defense or U.S. EPA) clients along with State\u002FLocal government and private sector clients is a plus. The WSP Northwest Operation is a multi-disciplinary science and engineering organization that offers the opportunity to work on technically challenging projects for a wide range of clients locally and throughout the US. We are a close-knit team of dedicated professionals working to find solutions for our diverse customer base. Our team of knowledgeable and skilled engineers, geoscientists, chemists, data visualization specialists deliver high quality and technical excellence on complex and diverse local projects, while benefiting from the structure, resources, and opportunities of a large international organization, and we are looking to grow our team in supporting our current workload as well as advancement of our strategic plan and vision.<\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Your Impact<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Consult for federal, municipal, commercial, and industrial clients on environmental investigation and remediation projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage complex site investigation and remediation projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Provide leadership to environmental science and engineering staff<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Work with project managers and other project staff locally and nationally to support environmental investigation and restoration projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Lead and support engineering design and remedial construction work<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ensure a high level of quality, effectiveness, and efficiency in our work to achieve client and company goals<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Active participation in business development and proposal efforts<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Participate in companywide initiatives and work groups<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Help plan and execute business growth and improvement strategies<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Keep an eye on the future and look for new horizons and services to pursue<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Who You Are<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n      <ul> \n       <li>Minimum BS in Environmental Engineering, Civil Engineering or a related engineering field required<\u002Fli> \n       <li>12+ years of experience<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Professional registration in Oregon or Washington (with ability to add the other State if missing)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated expertise and success in feasibility evaluation, remedial design, remedial action, and long-term operation &amp; maintenance of remediation systems<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated knowledge of and experience working under the MTCA regulatory paradigm<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and a strong team building orientation<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Consistent and highly accurate project work<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Ability to work efficiently and demonstrate effective organizational skills<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Flexible to work outside of business hours, when necessary<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proficiency with MS Office: Excel, Word, and Outlook as well as typical engineering software<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Experience with Bentley ProjectWise is a plus<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Must pass drug test, background check and must have a satisfactory driving record in accordance with the company's driving (MVR) policy<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful> \n      <p><b>Compensation and Benefits:<\u002Fb><br> <br> WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> Expected Salary: $125,200 - $255,400<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP USA is providing the compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that the company in good faith believes it might pay and\u002For offer for this position based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities in addition to internal equity and geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> #LI-SS2<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp> \n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Additional Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Additional Details<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Travel Required:<\u002Fb> N\u002FA - No travel required<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Job Status:<\u002Fb> Regular<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Employee Type:<\u002Fb> Full<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>Primary Location: <\u002Fb>PORTLAND - SW AVE<\u002Fli> \n       <li><b>All locations:<\u002Fb> US-OR-Portland, US-WA-Kirkland, US-WA-Lynnwood<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About WSP<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n      <p> WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<\u002Fp> \n      <p> WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<\u002Fp> \n      <p> At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges.
